description:
I love this place, but not because of the food. The food itself is mediocre and not all that great. It would be standard sushi rolls you could get from a stall in a mall.

The value, while decent, is also not why I love this place. For $32, you get all you can eat sushi, beer and sake. Pretty good deal if you ask me, as you'd pay way more for the amount you can get at other places.

The real reason this place is awesome is because of the crowd. Because pretty much everyone does AYCE, and you get free sake and beer, basically everyone does sake bombs all night, and in our case together!

After a few sake bombs, everyone in the restaurant is pretty much doing sake bombs with you, with one person yelling sake sake sake to the whole restaurant and everyone else yelling bomb back. It's a pretty awesome experience and it basically makes everyone at your table way more drunk than they intended to be.

Loads of fun, but don't come expecting good food.
author: Tyler T.

description:
What's not to love here? I always bring friends and coworkers here because this place is IT. Of course I come for the AYCE sushi and drinks - a must have. Usually in AYCE sushi places the quality of sushi sucks, but this place is actually very consistent with the deliciousness of the sushi. 

Overall, I am a loyal customer here and will continue to bring all my people here for a good and delicious time.
author: Sarah J.

description:
All you can eat sushi, appetizers and drinks for $32 on weekdays. Pretty good deal if you can eat more than a couple rolls + drinks. Drinks include Beer and Hot Sake.  

I just had my first experience here on a Thursday night for a friends' birthday, party of 9, he was able to call ahead to reserve a table for such a large group. This place is on the smaller side, 10-12 tables total, so I can see wait times here racking up with the 2-hr AYCE time limit. The waitstaff was attentive and was able to handle such high volume orders without any hiccups. 

The appetizers were my favorite part of the AYCE experience. Shout out to all the FRIED FOOD appetizers, which were all very tasty. The gyoza were cooked perfect, nice crunch and with tasty meat filling. The sesame chicken was the star of the appetizers, very unassuming on the menu. Packed with a ton of flavor, nice batter exterior and juicy chicken interior. I'm a huge fan of tonkatsu, and anytime I can eat unlimited orders, I'm going to take advantage of it. Cooked to order, it wasn't the best tasting katsu, but it hit the spot. 

Now, If you are coming here for the just the sushi, it leans toward the side of middle of the road. We tried every specialty roll on the AYCE menu, and not one really stood out from the rest. The flavors were not really there, as the fish didn't taste very fresh, and it became hard to distinguish the taste between the rolls. If I ordered sushi only, I would've left a bit disappointed. 

All in all, if your primary focus is to DRINK, this is a great option, with the food being a bonus. But if you are trying to go more sushi focused, I would try my luck at a different spot.
author: Paolo B.

description:
Came here on a whim cause my friend & I were hungry and there aren't really any AYCE sushi places in SF. 

The place is kind of small, and there were two large parties seated, so the atmosphere was loud.  I work with kids so I'm around screaming all day so it didnt bother me too much. 

The food - the sushi was hella mediocre and tiny like LOL not good. They were all drenched in sauce so they overpowered the flavors of anything else. I wasn't a fan. We ordered agedashi tofu & the tofu was sour, meaning it went bad. But they took it back and gave us another one. 

I gave two stars because our waitress was nice and had good service. Other than that, I wouldn't go back.
author: Kathleen A.

description:
My friend and I went for the AYCE and Drink special that happens on Friday and Saturday from 5-10 PM. I think the best way to break down this review is by using a Pros/Cons format, so here it goes:

Pros:
- AYCE and Drink is a pretty good deal at $35, but only really when you're going with a group (unless you can really down your drinks). We ultimately only finished with two large Asahis and two sake bottles, so we probably could have taken on a bit more.
- Tempura/croquettes are redeeming factors to the average sushi quality (which we ate at the tailend of our meal).
- We had a great server and food was brought out quickly and accurately, despite there being a large party being served that night.

Cons:
- Despite the $35 AYCE and Drink per person, the total came to $88. I didn't ask about it because we had a good night and service was good, but I think its a bit steep for what we expected.
- Sushi quality is pretty average, but expected for an AYCE. You can only get sushi rolls instead of any nigiri or sashimi, but I'm not too familiar if there are comparable deals in SF where you can get nigiri as well.

Although the place and ambience was fine and the service was great, the quality of the sushi and the price point for what we expected to pay ultimately dropped this to 3 stars instead of a solid 4. If you're looking for AYCE sushi, it's best to look elsewhere and buy drinks separately, granted that it may total to what we had paid for this AYCE and Drink deal.
author: David W.

description: Got food poisoning from this place last night. And not even the semi-decent food poisoning where at least it's delicious going down. The food was bad all around. None of the fish tasted like it went bad, though it was noticeably not fresh, so I'm going to guess this was a cleanliness issue. Avoid at all costs (which wasn't even cheap so really avoid it).
author: Erica G.

description:
Delicious and fresh!

We were a bit worried as it was our first time order sushi late in the day and on a weekday. Everything was to our satisfaction, including the presentation. We will definitely stop by or order more!
author: Janiela C.

description: Sushi Delight is definitely an experience. Where else do you go to get unlimited sake and sushi, I don't know if I can name anywhere else in the city. The sushi was subpar, and the small place is overpacked with rowdy people pounding on tables to saki bombs constantly. Definitely not a place to come on a first date or bring the parents, but if you are looking for a rowdy birthday party, or just to get stuffed and lit, this is your go to place. I must say though, if my Japanese grandmother saw this, she would not be having it.
author: Ross S.

description:
This is what a sushi heaven feel like in my stomach? Lol oh yess~ 

Background:
I was looking for a karaoke bar that people can sing their hearts out in front of strangers. But no no, the party is actually the next door, although they are a joint place, meaning that you can order from this place to that party place (again next door lol) Complicated? Well, just call the place and they'll do the thorough explaining hehe

The likes:
-Foods! Oh course sushi was good, but it wasn't like a wow kind of sushi but it was just an average, average that you can get it just about anywhere kind of sushi. 
-Best part, 2 hrs of all you can eat sushi for $29! So as the cheap students that we are we rush in and order all of them, but two or three at a time so we can at least get the food coming and we didn't want to get hated on lol. Special rolls are part of this deal! 
-That deal also applies to drinks, only alcoholic drinks for $25. Be beware the beer drinks are a bottle size
-Last moment polaroid picture! Added to their own wall collection. Not yours to keep, but theirs. Oh and look for "Spicy girls and salty boy" ! I'm there hehe I'm part of their memories~

The between:
-Complimentary bday dessert, but it was just one mochi ice cream. Split it into four pieces for four people lol one size fit one finger for one person. Complicated? Well, check out my photos for this place
-Staffs, nice folks. But, both lack English so it does take some effort and some hand suggestions to get some dialogue going. But again nice fun folks

The umm:
-The Shitake Maki has one ingredient: mushroom. Personally, I hate mushrooms so this stays here, but my friends said it was good and had some sweet to it. Others give it a try, YOLO!
-Seaweed, it was overly sweet and was too liquidly
-Chicken teriyaki is literally just grill chicken and does come with the teriyaki sauce but the sauce itself was too blend. Just grill yo our chicken at home guyss
-Cleanness, they need to work on that. Our table was just sticky and one plate even had a tiny particles of seaweed when we got the plate. 
 
Experience it again? I want to keep this as part of my happy moments and should stay like that. But yes, I'll go again like in 3 yrs just to see if the Polaroid pic is still there. So don't forgot about me~ restaurant
author: Hye L.

description: I hate wasabi but I think the sushi chef's knife had some on it because ALL the sushi pieces had some wasabi on it. I couldn't eat any of it.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
WORST PLACE EVER! 
DON't GO TO THIS PLACE IF YOU DON'T WANT TO BE TREATED LIKE SH$^#. We filled the place with a 15 people table it was literally just us.  We were of course bunch of people and wanted to paid by couples. The manager or owner or cook,  got so upset about that and told us to do "WHATEVER THE FUCK WE WANT"(literally) and leave. The stupid waitress THREW the bill to us. 
It was the WORSTTTTTTT customer service I've ever had in MY LIFE! And the Food sucksss beer was warm, the delivery of the food was soo unorganized.
author: Gabriela M.

description:
Was in the area tonight and had 2 options: this place or taco bell. I should've gotten taco bell. To start off, I've been sick for the past several hours after leaving this restaurant. The whole experience was so unejoyable. There were 2 big parties there being SO loud I was starting to get a headache, the workers didn't seem to mind all their yelling and screaming but not too enjoyable for the rest of the customers. 
Really disappointed in the food. Got the shrimp tempura rainbow roll. Be warned, the INGREDIENTS ARE NOT THE SAME AS THE MENU. Got this roll because it was one of the few not marked as spicy. To my surprise, there was an overwhelming amount of a wasabi sauce on top of the roll which was not mentioned anywhere on the menu. When I brought it up to the waiter, with attitude she responded "uh what do you want me to do about it?? Change it??" Yes, if you advertise one thing and give me something else, I want to get what I ordered. I got a new order with no sauce on top but still wasn't pleased. The shrimp tempura tasted really off which is what left me with a bad taste in my mouth and an even worse feeling in my stomach. Definitely won't be back.

Summary:
Atmosphere: Too Loud 
Food: Made me Sick
Menu: Limited, ingredients not accurate 
Service: Slow and Rude 
Pricing: Expensive for what you get
author: Kiana N.

description:
I have to admit my expectations were really low after reading some of the low reviews on yelp but it turned out to be much better than expected. I came for a joint bday dinner of two friends and we booked the entire 45 seat restaurant. We did all you can drink and eat.

+ They did a great job feeding us! They set up a side table where the chefs kept delivering food to. There was always sushi and other things like tempura, potato croquette, edamame, etc available. They also brought out tons of hamachi kamas, which were large pieces and very delicious!

+ Thee waitress did a great job checking our alcohol and making sure the same bottles were full. Service was extremely attentive and fast.

+ They let us play our own music and start a dance party after we ate.

+ Sushi quality was not the best, but good enough to be tasty.

There's obviously much better sushi places in the SF, but this was a fun ayce place for a bday party.
author: Sophia H.

description: Ordered sushi from here thru Uber eats. I have a few allergies, but sushi is usually alright for me despite one of my allergies being soy. However, the food was inedible when it arrived. There was soy sauce smothered over half the rolls (it wasn't a listed ingredient) and the little soy containers leaked out onto the rest of the sushi. Couldn't eat anything. I know soy sauce goes along with sushi, but I have never had this problem at any other sushi place I've been to. Pretty disappointed.
author: Raquel G.

description:
I'm puzzled at how Sushi Delight isn't more busy.  Let me break this down for you: 

1. $25 all you can drink
2. $29 all you can eat
3. All you can eat sushi costs $4. FOUR DOLLARS.

Sushi Delight is next door to Mint Karaoke. Sometimes when there are a lot of people karaoke-ing that have ordered before you, your orders take longer to receive. But, at least you get to watch all the rockstars on the big screen belting out while stuffing their face with sushi.

The food here is nothing special (and stick with the specialty rolls) but with the time limit you're able to stuff your face with unlimited amounts of sushi for two hours and produce a massive food baby. Who's not down? I'm usually not interested in eating average sushi but for some reason at Sushi Delight, it's quantity over quality. 

Also, if you don't finish a decent amount of food, THEY WILL CHARGE YOU. I suggest finding a place to put it...like perfectly placed in the round hole in the back of each chair (ok just kidding, please don't do that) or your stomach. 

They deliver, but honestly I would skip it because the cost of two specialty sushi rolls is just as much as all you can eat and drink here.
author: Shereen A.

description:
Delivery guy extorted me and wouldn't deliver my food bc the tip wasn't a large enough amount. It was 12% which isn't bad. He only gave me my food after I offered cash. Perhaps this place should pay their delivery people more so they don't behave like this.  The delivery also took an hour and a half. 
I haven't even tried the food- won't be ordering again.
author: Jason S.

description: Made a reservation at this place. They had no idea. Language barrier? Player favoritism? Picked big parties over small party
author: Robert B.

description: Loud place, indifferent service. I paid $13 for a sakura roll (takeout), and it was small and mediocre - definitely not worth the price. Also, the soy sauce it came was too salty, likely the chemically brewed kind. I wouldn't recommend this place.
author: Josh L.

description:
Sushi Delight is a good choice for a quick sushi bite, or if you're drunk and finished with Karaoke next door. Honestly, there are much better sushi options in the city, but also way more expensive ones.

Currently, they offer an "All you can eat" option for $25 - which makes total sense if you plan on eating more than 2 rolls as each roll already is about $12-$19. Pretty hefty. Go for the combo.

Great for groups that don't care for fanciness and just want to get their food. All others, including couples looking for a romantic dinner, make rezzies elsewhere.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
This is the go to order place when you had a few drinks at the Mint Karaoke Lounge. It is connected together and you can go in a order and they will bring the food to you, pretty sweet and convenient. 

We ordered a few rolls:
Lava Roll: OK
Voodoo Roll: Pretty cool presentation, the seaweed salad is on on top of the roll with a spicy mayo sauce, taste is OK
Cherry Blossom Roll: OK, nothing special
Spicy Tuna Roll: OK, I didn't like the jalapenos mixed inside 

Overall, everything is very ok, probably after a few drinks everything tastes amazing. Sushi is not the freshest, too much rice, quality of ingredient is meh. I wouldn't come here purposely for sushi, but it is very convenient if you are karaoking at The Mint, the majority of their business are from there.
author: Natalie L.

description: This place is waaaayyyyyy toooo loud to come in and eat. Service sucked!! Waitress is on your ass to make  sure you don't share. FUCK this place!! Never again. BTW, food was fucking horrible!!  It's a fucking joke!!!
author: Einstein G.

description: I've only eaten here once but it was memorable in a good way. Ordered a variety of rolls and nigiri with three other people the applies the "soy sauce" test, i.e. does the fish taste fresh when not dipped in soy-wasabi. Sushi Delight passed the test.
author: Tim P.

description:
This place is the worst place to eat, the waiters were really rude! When my friend ask where the restroom was the chefs gave him attitude. Their food tastes decent, some tastes like pee, mediocre, and horrible. The people had no motivation to work, and it was very expensive! They charge you tip in the TOTAL amount. The tip/gratuity amount was 25.20$ and none of us wanted to pay for it since they were extremely rude and ALREADY added in the total bill.

Don't come to this restaurant, my friend threw up eating their food.
author: Steve L.

description: Portion sizes are laughable. Overpriced and very little food. Go somewhere else. Speedy delivery but not much food at all.
author: Ac C.

description:
I went here with four friends who were doing all you can eat sushi. Waitress asks if I'm doing it too, and I say no. They then ordered miso soup. She asked "five miso soup?" -- "no, just us four" they said. Four miso soups and a lot of sushi later, she gives us a bill for five all you can eat diners. We tried explaining the logic behind why this bill was wrong, but to no avail. I paid $36 that night.

Atmosphere: 10/10
Food: wouldn't know
Service: 0/10
author: Kelsey M.

description: Love this place!!! Went out with some friends and got all you can eat sushi and drinks. Super fun environment with karaoke next door! Thanks for the great find yelp!
author: Alex M.

description:
This place is NOT as bad as everyone thinks. The deal is really good $25 for all you can eat and $29 for all you can eat AND drink.
Food came out kind of slow but we ordered a lot the first round and got pretty full off of that.
Tiger roll and rainbow roll were my favorite!
author: Dominique V.

description: Food was pretty good, but I've had better. The house salad was probably my favorite. The bill was split between only 3 people and the tip was still included, which was very odd to me. The amount of tip that was included for each person was not worth it. Service was kind of slow, did not apologize for anything and we waited about 20-30 minutes just to get our bill. Please keep track of your tables.
author: Kanella G.

description:
This is my 2nd review for Sushi Delight.  I don't remember how many times I have came to sushi d for their AYCE & DRINK Thur out the years. 
The restaurant is not big but what really surprised me and my friends is that they can accommodate a big group.

This time we have a group of 30+ppls.  We came on a Friday night for our friends Bday!  When we got there they already have the tables set-up for us and we don't have to wait which is a plus!! Even if we do have to wait we still understand cus it's on a Friday night.

The restaurant was very busy so our foods end up coming out alil later than normal, which total acceptable!!! All the staff including the owner Ray was very nice they even pump up the music for us and we all had a blasted!! They even help us take a group pic and posted on their wall, we had so much fun w/the sake bomb!  We got so loud and the other guest in the restaurant join us lols!!

I definitely recommend this place especially if you want to have a wonderful time partying w/ur forks chilling,drinking and eating away....
author: Bella J.

description:
AYCE sushi is hard to come by around here, so I was stoked when my friend suggested coming here. Admittedly, not the best sushi you'll ever have but at this price, I wasn't looking for my mind to be blown. You can order a bunch of different apps on top of the rolls, so that was nice!

Favorites: tempura, seaweed salad, cherry blossom roll, 49er roll.
DO NOT GET THE AGEDASHI TOFU. It is fried tofu but it is not agedashi tofu. Heart broken.

When we got there at 7pm on a Saturday, it was surprisingly half empty, so we got seated right away. An hour later, we were literally shouting across the table to be heard. The service also slowed down significantly at this time.

When we tried to order a few more items at the end, the waitress was suuuuper hesitant, and we were just like uh why not? She looked at her watch and relented. We haven't met our time limit (2 hours) and you never check on us! I want more tempura and my friend wants more beer.. WE DESERVE MORE CALORIES!!

I believe on weekdays it's $25 for AYCE or AYCD; $29 for both. Weekends it's $29 for one, $33 for both. Tip automatically applied. Good place to get stuffed and/or wasted on kinda horrible hot sake. I don't know if I can quite eat that much subpar sushi, nor do I really want to in the future.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Working here takes a lot of patience. I think shabu house is more conducive to a collegial feeling than sushi, but you can get really drunk and eat a lot of sushi here and it's not bad.

You know what you're getting yourself into. Overall, service is +++ and the food is +- (i.e. Decent not great) - but yeah anyway you should go here if you want to ears lot of sushi and start the night off with saki bombs.
author: Andrew C.

description: Amazing experience every time. So much fun with a group of friends. Great sushi, beer, & sake. Love the all you can eat. Waitresses can be hard to get ahold of so you need to be aggressive. If you want a polaroid of you & your friends on the wall, just ask a waitress!
author: Jackie L.

description: Legitimately really good. I went on a weekend for the eat and drink special. Food was good not great, but the drinks came out fast so what more can you ask for. Highly recommend. I will be coming back
author: Ryan L.

description: For me and my daughter this food was great and she's pretty hard to please. The chicken catsu was delicious and I loved the shrimp tempura. Definitely will be ordering from them again
author: Janet R.

description:
The sushi is crap. The space is pretty cramped. 

With that said you don't go for the sushi but for the all-you-can-drink special. You have to keep asking them to bring you more sake and beer or otherwise they'll hold back. 

Probably wouldn't come back here again for the food but it makes for a good time if you're coming with a group. The karaoke bar next door is great.
author: Cindy W.

description:
I came here for my boyfriend's birthday dinner with about a group of 8 people. We were able to get a table pretty quickly for a weekend night. The place is pretty tiny, and the service was decent. It was hard flagging down our waitress every time we wanted to put in the new order-she seemed to be really busy with all the other tables too.

It took awhile for our sushi to come out every round-- pretty sure they missed a couple rolls but it seems understandable considering there were only two sushi chefs and there were two large parties in the restaurant as well. 

As far as sushi goes, the menu has a decent selection-- the fish wasn't that fresh and the rolls weren't super delicious but it was decent enough for being all you can eat. We also did the all you can drink and the alcohol selection was good!

All in all, I would come here again (maybe), if they added better rolls to the menu and their service picks up.
author: Lina T.

description:
I'm DELIGHTED I don't ever have to eat here again.

More suited for the drunken peeps that spillover from the Mint next door, this is the place to go for late night eats at bargain prices. $25 for all you can eat sushi?! HECK YA. You bring your Kobayashi game on, but then you realize that the sushi is crowned in magic sauce to make it more appealing to your hungry belly. Meh.

Give me pristine fish any day with a $$$ and I'm happy to pay the price.
author: Janice C.

description:
It's not about the ambience - this place gets packed and could really use some sound-absorbing foam or something on the walls. Groups of young and seemingly irresponsible drinkers will be shouting Sake bomb chants and banging on the tables right next to you.

It's not about the best sushi you've ever had - but it's also far from the worst!! I bet some people would say it's amaaaazing, but I've been to Tsukiji fish market in Japan so I'm really comparing it to the best sushi in the world. I'm Japanese so just trust me.)

It's about getting full and drunk on the BEST DEAL EVER!! It's like ~$30 (cheaper on weekdays I think) for ALL YOU CAN EAT sushi AND drinks. Yes, that one price for both!!! Considering that a specialty sushi roll and one fancy cocktail can cost $15 each somewhere else, this is a spectacular deal. I'm in my 20s so maybe I'll grow out of this need to stuff my face with good-not-great sushi and get drunk af off beer/sake... but for now I love it.

You don't need to be a sushi eater to come here either. Plenty of non-raw fish options like gyoza (dumplings,) seaweed salad, chicken teriyaki, miso soup, etc. There's a lot more but I was busy eating sushi so I can't remember lol.

10000% need a reservation on weekends and try to make it before the day of if you want a certain time. 

Weekday was super empty which I prefer but it's hard to gather friends to drink on a Tuesday night lol.

If you're doing AYCE, the more people the merrier (so you can share and try a lot of different things off the menu.)
author: Fl00fy L.

description: Honestly I came to this place thinking it was decent. I am baffled by how rude the staff was and how their service was. Food was mediocre and the place was very loud. When we were ordering the food the lady was very rude and it felt like we were not welcomed. The food took forever to come even though there was barely people coming to the place. To make it worse they forced gratuity on us even though their service was terrible. Coming here was a mistake and would not recommend to anyone to come here.
author: Jimmy F.

description: Awful service!! Food was mediocre. Saw a  waiter falling asleep near our table. When i asked the waitress to split the bill she rudely ignored my request so me and my friend paid with cash, waitress then complained about leaving her a tip!
author: Izbeth M.

description: Best deal in town! $29 for AYCE and drink. Came to this location for my birthday and they were able to accommodate 20 people and get food out fast. I love that it's attached to the karaoke bar and they have a tv showing who is singing next door.
author: Kelly G.

description:
Ordered delivery on a Tuesday night. it showed up more than an hour late (two hours after ordering), the hot food was ice cold, one item was missing, and they included one small container of soy sauce for a $40+ order.

There are lots of good sushi places in San Francisco. This is not one of them, at least for delivery.
author: Brian V.

description: Food is not as displayed as the menu. The bento box is just a plate of little things here and here and not an actual bento box like the menu portrayed as. Also, the chicken katsu that I had with the bento box, suuuuuper thin. Barely any meat. After I'm done, I'm still hungry! I wouldn't come back again. Lame.
author: Tommy T.

description: NOOOO, HAIR IN MY SUSHI!!! First of all the actual sushi is disgusting. The avocado tasted like it was outside for days. Same goes with the rest of the sushi and it's contents!!!! Im disgusted. Please don't waste your time
author: Xennia E.

description:
This review is for a delivery order via EAT24.  The food arrived on time, but the delivery person waited outside for me to come out to pick it up and spoke very little English, so I didn't try to ask him to bring it down the hallway 3 doors away.

Food that should have been hot was cold and they provided a very small container of dipping  sauce for the tempura.  Otherwise I thought the tempura was good, as were the gyozas.  The sushi was good, but not great.
author: Estelle A.

description: My favorite place to go eat,super nice patrons,very homey,I always meet nice and different people sitting at the sushi bar,Ray the Chef always have the best and creative food ideas,the best in town, this is the only place to visit to have a great spiritual food experience !!!!!!!!!
author: Francis G.

description: Amazing deal! And good for large groups! The place gets loud so it's hard to have small talk with other. The sake wasn't hot which is one of my favorite beverages warm. The rolls too awhile to get to us since there were large groups. Food and drinks were totally worth the price!
author: Kristin D.

description:
SaaaaaaywhaaaaaaaaAll you can eat and drink special for $30?!!?! Yes, plz. 

So is this the best sushi I've ever had? Nope. But it's not the worst either. It's a little tricky for me to do my gluten-free thang here, lots of tempura, but there are a few big rolls I can choose from and they're happy to accommodate no sauces if they contain soy sauce. They also have tamari on hand which is a huge plus. I'll usually get a can of Diet Coke and a large sake (or 3). Beer is also included in the drink options. The staff is also super cool. It can get busy so try to hit it on an off-hour. 

This is honestly a great place to go to when you're feeling ravenous or need to lube up the vocal chords, and courage, before hitting The Mint next door.
author: Carol M.

description: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!! Very disappointing!! I gave this place a try because it had 4 stars and really wanted sushi but I was stuck at work. Ordered delivery using Eat24 and I will never ever order from here again. I ordered Shrimp Tempera, Dragon roll, Cherry Blossom Roll, and it came with a free California roll and it was disgusting with the exception of the shrimp tempera. Wish I could get my money back. If I could give negative stars I would. The delivery driver was also very rude plus tried to ask for a tip when it took over 90 minutes to deliver my food.
author: Alexandria M.

description:
Simple, inexpensive sushi hole-in-the-wall spot!

Their sushi rolls fulfilled my craving for sushi and their hamachi kama was smooth and delicious.  One note, however, is that they forgot my wasabi when serving the sushi dishes up.  It's forgiven.

They have this slightly random and entertaining TV screen that displays the karaoke scene from next door.  Whoever is karaoking next door at this bar named Mint, is displayed on this TV screen.  I wonder if they know that they are being showcased.  It was quite a show.  

Other than that, their sushi was doable.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
The food here wasn't terrible, it was your average sushi roll joint, but the service was AWFUL. As me and my two friends currently sit at our table, it has been almost two hours since we were seated and we've only been brought our second plate of food from the "all you can eat" menu, which also happens to have a two hour time limit per table as well as additional fees for not finishing your food and added gratuity no matter the size of your party. 

It took almost an hour for our second order to come and we honestly don't know how long we'll be waiting for the last part of our order and then the check. The restaurant isn't even busy so I don't know what could be taking so long but I have never waited so long for rolls to be made at a sushi place before. For $29 plus gratuity and tax, we definitely did not get our money's worth. 0/10 do not recommend.
author: Kirsten W.

description:
I was craving sushi, so I used my handy dandy Yelp app and searched sushi in my area. Ugh.. There's a sushi place 3 blocks from me? How have I never heard of this place. I thought why the hell not, I'll give it a go! 

I walked right on over, which took a total of 60 seconds. It's right next to The Mint, and when I entered I realized that it's actually connected to The Mint! I was confused because I go to The Mint every so often, and I feel like I would have remembered that there was a sushi spot connected? Then I realized the reason I never noticed is because I'm always a little tipsy when I'm at The Mint ;-)

I was the only customer in the restaurant, which is always kind of a.. sign. But, the chefs looked busy, and there was a line of to go orders scattered on the bar. This lead me to the conclusion that this spot is more popular for delivery than eating in. Which, I totally understand, as I have over 500 Eat24 delivery orders to date! (No shame.)

I got the bento box with avocado/cucumber roll, california roll, and chicken teriyaki. About as BASIC as you can get when it comes to sushi. How on earth could you screw this up?

First comes out the miso soup. I'm aware that most sushi spots make their miso soup using a mix with hot water, and throw in some generic tofu bits. But, I still usually end up liking it. THIS soup tasted like hot water with pepper. Pretty bad. Which is surprising because I feel like it's really hard to mess up miso soup, no?

Then my bento box came out. I could tell as soon as it came out that it was sub-par sushi. Which, is okay, I'm not expecting 'Ozumo's' quality here. I tried the cali roll first. The crab meat was.. warm? I could tell it wasn't being refrigerated properly. Warm crab meat that's supposed to be served cold is a big no no. Next, I tried the avo roll. Pretty.. okay. No complaints. The salad was kinda weird.. The dressing was way too watery and it ruined the salad. The chicken teriyaki was, again, just okay. The chicken was good, but the sauce tasted like it was cheap grocery store sauce. 

$15 for 2 rolls, chicken teriyaki, rice, salad and soup. Can't complain.. Actually, yeah I can. Probably won't be coming back.
author: Alex G.

description: Worst sushi I've ever had! Rice is mushy! Presentation is a joke, I ordered 2 different kinds of rolls and they both came in a very small take out box. And each sushi should've be cut to 1.5 inches. This one was so tiny I believed its 1/2 of an inch . Probably need to use a magnifying glass to be able yo enjoy it.
author: Jennifer C.

description: My delivery experience was great. Got bentobox 3 item for 15$ chickenkatsu is great, the beef teriyaki was a lot and its tender n delicious and the gyoza is good too it comes With rice, salad the dressing was awesome I liked it how they put the sauce separated and miso soup which is great. it was worth it I'll order here again. I got free California roll it was good.
author: Jhaydelyn E.

description: Terrible! They say its $33 a person but we ended up paying $83 for 2. Quality of food is low end and hot sake is cold. If you are a r3al sushi eater please go somewhere else.
author: Natalie N.

description:
Friendly staff that was patient with us tourists, but the sushi is mediocre. Only came for the $29 all you can eat and drink sushi. **NOTE: The all you can eat menu is limited. No nigiri or sashimi, and it is very limited in rolls.

As a tourist, we were looking for an AYCE sushi place (pretty much every sushi place has it where we come from). We stumbled across this place with a giant sign that advertises their AYCE option for $29 and a pleasant surprise when we find out it includes drinks as well. 

Even though SF is known for their fresh fishes and delicious food, Sushi Delight was one of the places where the sushi just tasted "all right." On top of the limited options on AYCE, the rolls that I ordered seemed to have fish that weren't fresh and overall the food left an unimpressionable memory.

Sorry, but I would never come here again or recommend this place to anyone. I am definitely going to try a different place in SF -- as I believe any sushi place might've been better than this!
author: Toby Y.

description: I order from sushi delight every so often and haven't had a problem until now. I ordered a tekka maki and its not its normal pink color but a beige and I don't think fish should look like that.
author: Sasha H.

description: Food was delivered on time and order was correct but that was the extent of the positive review.  The food was substandard at best and not worth the price.  Between the smell, the appearance and taste, we would not recommend Sushi Delight to anyone.
author: Mel F.

description:
For such a foodie area, I was surprised this sushi spot didn't live up to my expectations. Out on a date night, we ordered the "Dinner For Two A" for $59.00 which included edamame, 2 miso soup, seaweed salad (or house salad), gyoza, 10 pcs nigiri, shrimp tempura rainbow roll, dynamite roll, 2 spicy tuna handroll, and 2 pcs mochi ice cream (we got strawberry and green tea)! The edamame and miso soup were standard, seaweed salad had a unique flavor that I didn't care for, and the sushi was so-so. It ended up being way too much food for the two of us. If I go back, I'll definitely select my own rolls. 

Overall average sushi. The best part about this place is the live feed to Mint (karaoke bar next door). That was totally hilarious!
author: Nicole W.

description:
REVIEW FOR DELIVERY SERVICE


These guys list themselves as 45-60, but the NEVER deliver in this timeframe.  And the delivery guy will curse you out, when providing no tip for food over 45 min beyond the max time.  This is the fourth consecutive time they are more than 30 min late.

I will never order from them again... nor should you... at least if you want food in under 1.5 hours.

These guys just need to not accept orders when they are swamped, or list themselves with a much longer delivery window.  I don't know, but they do not deliver what they claim.
author: Dan O.

description: God AWFUL restaurant. If you plan to go with a big group, go somewhere else. Had all you can eat and drink and didn't get one single thing I ordered. The waitresses went table by table to see what we wanted but never brought the food to different parts of the bi group. Went 2 hours without getting food and had to order the same 5 rolls two times and had to t talk the manager another time and still didn't get our food. Overall shitty service. Spend your hard earned money somewhere else. I understand things get busy but this was ridiculous. No communication or anything. HORRIBLE restaurant
author: Miguel A.

description:
First off let me say their regular sushi meals are good. Not great, but good.

Last night I tried the "All you can eat (sushi) & drink deal" - $29.00 a person. The drinks are a choice of 3 different beers, soda and Hot Sake only. 

The sushi they offer are rolls only, no sashimi.  You may only order 2 rolls at a time, per person and with each order, came with more and more RICE. Very little fish. 

We were sadly disappointed within 10 minutes of eating our meal. Not to mention the waitress barely made time for us.  I have to guess part of the -skimping out- deal. If she ignores you most of the time, you barely have time to order while still hungry.

Had we known this was a bad deal, we would have ordered off the menu and not wasted our hopes on what we thought would be a very good dinner. Instead we felt kind of ripped off. With SO MANY SUSHI places to choose from, I won't be going back to Sushi Delight and it's unfortunate in that they are roughly 1/4 of a block from my house.  

My advice would be, just be fair, give you what offer and you'll draw in customers. Cheat people or try to hide the deal with so much rice, ii will make you sick, it's simply bad customer service.
author: Valerie M.

description:
If you're looking for cheap sake then its great. if you want to have a 285 $ charge for 2 bowls of edamame and drinks then this place is also great. If you have a big group they try to get you to get their "All you can eat and drink" for 33$ deal and if you're naive they tell you that you wanted that and they'll charge you for it. The first time I came here it was a group of 9 and we weren't smart and got the all you can drink deal and our total was over 350$. I came again with 3 people and we ordered a few drinks and the total was under 30. I went again last night with 6 people and they charged us 285$ because they said we ordered the "all you can eat and drink". When we got our bill we were in disbelief. I was able to talk to the waitress who gave in to my pleas and cancelled our 224$ credit card bill. When she came back and charged us only for what we ordered the total was 81$. Also they charge 18% for groups because they KNOW you wouldn't tip them if they didn't 

I can't give a rating for their sushi, I've never tried it. But what I can say is DON'T GET THE ALL YOU CAN EAT AND DRINK DEAL. I promise you it's a scam. 

I'm just hopeful that when she said she cancelled the charge, that she actually cancelled it.. I'll check my bank statement and report back, as of now the transaction is pending..
author: Carmel G.

description: Service was good , five stars but food was a no go. Wanted to try an ayce place and came upon this place. The ayce menu did not have sashimi or nigiri which was what I wanted. They only had rolls which has tiny slices of fish on it. Definitely not worth the price (31$) the quality was no bueno! Will not be back
author: Michelle H.

description: Eat24 review- So delivered sushi can either go really well or terribly wrong right? In my case it went really well. Sunday night I'm craving sushi without leaving the house. I ordered the shrimp tempura rainbow roll and sake maki roll. It arrived earlier than expected by a courteous delivery guy and the food was good! Thanks guys made my night
author: Rachel T.

description: Would give Zero stars if I could. Terrible  and SLOW service. This place is a joke. We barely got 2 rounds in our 2 hours here. Do not bother coming here, the sushi is decent at best. Not worth the wait at all. I wish I had never been here at all. The place is super small, we had to continuously get up to accommodate other parties that were seated. You will feel like a sardine being packed into such a tight space.
author: Richard G.

description: BAD SUSHI... WORSE SERVICE!!!!  AYCE but no sashimi  just rolls.  When we complained that the sushi has expired the sushi chef was arguing with us about how fresh it was but our stomachs were hurting and we haven't even left the restaurant and told us they don't want us as customers.  The waitress had m a bad attitudes and spilled miso soup on us and dropped tempura, picked it up with her hand and put it back on the plate and to charge 20% with a party of 6 or more.  20% for that service. NEVER AGAIN!!!
author: Sophia M.

description: First off, Terrible service!!! Second, the all you can eat for $29, total rip off! Sushi, mediocre. Lastly, again... Terrible service! Beware.
author: Yvette J.

description: Worst place ever! AYCE Sushi without the sushi is the most ridiculous concept ever. only food available are rolls with old spoiled fish and a bunch of cheap appetizers. When we complained about the quality of sushi, the chef (if you can even call him that) told us we didn't know good quality. My stomach shouldn't be hurting after 2 bites of food. Never again with this terrible wannabe sushi restaurant.  Rude service coupled with rotting food makes for an unhappy customer. Obviously!
author: Christina J.

description:
This place is a rip off. Got a specialty roll. Waitress told me it would be 8 pieces and it was only 6. The size was super small too. The specialty roll is supposed to be larger than a regular California roll and it was the same size. They were also really stingy with their napkins. What the hell?! I would've complained but we were next door at the karaoke bar and I was already given a bad look earlier because I wanted to start a tab (to combine the appetizer and main course).

Later on I saw a guy with fried chicken. He said he got it from one of those delivery services that you contact through an app. Try that if you're at the karaoke joint.
author: Sophia I.

description:
Review for delivery service only!

Terrible service. Boyfriend called in at 6:20pm for food to be delivered to his work (less than 1 mile away). At 8pm (2 hours later) food is still not here and they won't offer a refund. He had to leave work without the food. We tried calling and all they said was 'they are on their way.. 15 more mins' every time we called the restaurant. Not sure how they can run a business like this. Ridiculous! Foods probably not fresh anymore. Won't be bringing my business here. 

Just called again.. Asking how much longer they will take and they told us they cancelled the orders!!!! And will be offering credit! Very frustrating!
author: Lily M.

description:
Do not order from here !!! 

I placed an order for delivery, waited an hour and a half for it and it never showed up. Called the restaurant twice, once after an hour to see what was going on only to have them give me the ol' "It's on its way" line. Half hour later I called to ask for a refund, refused to give me one and kept asking me to just take a discount. Then while I was still on the phone with them they lied and said the delivery was outside and again asked me to just take the discount. At this point, I am standing outside at my door to let my partner inside and there is no one around. I refused to take a discount and still pay for food I didn't receive, and they finally tell me that they can't refund me and I have to go ask the delivery third party to refund me. Terrible experience.
author: Mara N.

description:
Ordered take-out from this place. The food quality is actually pretty good--the sushi is well made, and ok-fresh. The egg-chicken-katsu rice/Don I ordered was also very nicely packaged, with a sweet black sauce that was fairly tasty as well.

However, keep in mind that they charge 15 bucks for the sushi, and 11 bucks for the chicken katsu rice, which is not cheap given the small portions! I ate both the sushi combo and the rice combo in one meal, and I was still hungry afterwards. The miso soup that comes with the combos were also very small as well!

Overall, this is a pretty average sushi shop, but charges slightly above average prices.
author: Henry L.

description: Awful. Ordered for delivery. They said it would take 15 minutes while it took 75 minutes when my hotel was not more than two blocks from their location. The lady on the phone also called me SEVEN times trying to clarify my order. Save yourself the hassle and just go to chipotle. It's better anyways.
author: Gabe C.

description: Just experienced the worst side of San Francisco. Went to Sushi Delight to hit up their all you can eat special. As usual, it was super crowded so we expected a wait. We were waiting to put our name on the list for about 10 minutes. Groups of white Marina bros and their poor choice in female partners were getting drunker by the minute and almost screaming. I felt so bad for the wait staff.  We finally got one hostess' attention, and she said the tables were filled by a private party and they couldn't take anyone else. All the restaurant signs said "Open"...so we were understandably frustrated.  When we tried to leave, the Marina bros and their poor choice in female partners wouldn't move their chairs so we could get by.  We had to yell at them to move, and then they all started laughing at US. I don't understand. It was just...I am so saddened by what is happening to this beautiful city. Assholes, white privileged, and entitlement literally everywhere.
author: G G.

description: We love this place! The sushi is really fresh and the rolls are delicious. It's also a great place for larger groups. Definitely recommend!
author: Angelica N.

description: California roll was delicious; tempura too greasy; chicken teriyaki arrived lukewarm; seaweed salad tasty; took about 45 min to get our food; ordered around 830p on a Thursday.
author: IP B.

description: Let me just start of by saying that the service was absolutely horrible. After our first round of food and drinks the waiters started putting in our orders wrong and we never received the drinks we asked for. We then were served spoiled butterfish (it tasted sour and my stomach started hurting after one piece). When we informed the cooks about the spoils fish he yelled back, "you don't know what you're talking about. This fish is amazing !" Ummm ...  our stomachs say otherwise. After being yelled at, our bill was delivered and they over charged us by two people. Overall a horrible experience and we don't plan on returning. DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY!
author: Jasmine J.

description: All-you-can-eat and sushi still continue to prove themselves to me as not a possible combination. The $30 all you can eat and drink deal was appealing, but overall worthwhile. My friend's stomach started to hurt after a couple rolls, and I found them all to taste nearly identical. There was a strange smell in the building also.
author: Nikita K.

description:
Wandered in here after some time at the Mint next door. Agree with other reviewers that this is an average place not masquerading as anything different - our experience wasn't significantly wonderful or terrible. I had a special vegetarian roll that was totally acceptable.

Curious to try the all you can eat, but hesitant after reading some of these reviews. Eek!
author: Shendi X.

description:
Decent quality of all-you-can-eat sushi/cooked food and all-you-can-drink sake and beer. There are some good sushi roll options, but the list is not extensive, so we wound up ordering more of what we already tried. The food service was pretty quick and we did not need to wait long for our food. However, we needed to ask over and over again for drink orders.

Environment: The restaurant is pretty small and can only fit 1-2 large groups in addition to multiple tables of smaller groups. I came with a group of ~10 people and had a great time eating and catching up.
author: Angel G.

description: They're pork ramen was terrible. I didn't finish it at all, but they're teriyaki is good but they give you a small portion of rice on the side. Wouldn't order they're ramen but I'd come to try they're sushi. We'll see next time :b
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Although the sushi is just okay and pretty "Americanized," the service is really good. Especially since they serve you at The Mint karaoke bar next door.

But that's the only time I'd probably eat here - is if and when I'm at The Mint, which is probably only that once.
author: Alysha K.

description:
This restaurant is only a block from my house but I never once thought of eating there as the space seemed small and uninviting. But then I saw a banner for all you can eat AND drink sushi and alcohol for $29 and my interest was instantly piqued. So my partner and I tried it one night, preparing to feast, which we definitely did. The space is nothing to write home about and the place smelled slightly of urine, although after 5 minutes my nose adjusted and I didn't smell it anymore. I'm sure it wasn't urine, but probably the cleaning chemicals in the rug. Still, not a selling point if you're sensitive to smells. 

The sushi was just ok. The specialties rolls are the best, but the maki was so-so. The texture of the rice was rubbery which seemed odd to me. You can order anything you want from the regular menu, which was great, although you can only order two things at a time to cut down on possible waste(understandable).  They had all the most popular Japanese beers, served just slightly less cold than they should be, but being the boozers we are, we plugged through about 4 large beers and a few sakes.

The restaurant is located next to The Mint karaoke bar and they even have a TV screen dedicated to showing off the aspiring artists drunkenly belting out Journey songs next door. Actually pretty entertaining to be honest--I can't believe how wasted people can be at 6 in the evening!  

So we left the restaurant practically comatose feeling we definitely got our money's worth and then some.  One strange thing happened afterwards though: both my partner and I had to pee almost every half hour after the meal and then got up at least 5 times during the night. I can't imagine what could have been a diuretic in sushi, but something really got to us. Just thought I'd mention it in case it's happened to anyone else. It was really bizarre!

Anyways, I'm going to discount the peeing issues and  may try it again seeing it is a value proposition. Worth giving a shot, but don't expect anything exceptional.
author: kevin b.

description: My experience was cool. I love their menu specially spider roll, volcano roll and rainbow roll. Their sashimi was also fresh and delicious. I also have tried their other location at Geary st. Both locations are great! I prefer the one at Market st because there is a lot singing entertainment.
author: Mark C.

description:
I loved the sushi here. I've only ever ordered from the speciality section of the menu. The cherry blossom sushi (8 pieces for around $11) is delicious. Regular sushi (around 6 pieces) costs about $5, so it's good if you're on a budget. 

Inside, it's very, very casual. A date took me here once and the atmosphere was flat. The decor is... well... um... absent? However, they have a door at the side of the room that links the restaurant to The Mint (a fun karaoke bar) next door. They have absolutely no problem with people going into The Mint to eat and will bring the food to you.

If you want to eat at The Mint, you go into the restaurant, go to the cashier (at the back of the restaurant), and tell them you'd like to eat next door. You will be given a menu. You place your order and pay up front. They will ask you roughly where you'll be sitting, then they'll bring your food to you. 

I've always found the waitresses to be sweet and pleasant!
author: Emma R.

description: If I could give this place less than one star I would. The Asian guy with glasses who delivered my food made me FEARFUL as he haggled me for a tip. He even commented "no tip again,last time you didn't tip me either". I was about to tip him today until he was rude to me and banged on my door demanding tip money. As a struggling college student, this kind of experience doesn't help. I could only imagine how this horrible man treats others who are more unfortunate. I am never wasting my money at this place again, you shouldn't either.
author: Alyssa M.

description: Five stars for amazing sushi, all you can eat, the place is clean, friendly customer service and great location! I will definitely come back.
author: Mila N.

description: 3.5 - Solid sushi. My roll tasted good, but nothing Earth-shattering. Nice that it's attached to the Mint. Good concept.
author: Andrew K.

description: This is a great little Sushi Place attached the The Mint. The all you can eat special is a terrific value and quite dangerous when you try to maximize said value. Nevertheless, the fish is good and a wonderful neighborhood establishment. Lots of vegetarian options.
author: Amy J.

description: Left before we were served due to poor service.  Waitress was rude.  This place sounds like a great deal, but there are a lot of rules to the all you can eat.  If you go with other people who don't want that option then we were told they would have to leave the table and sit somewhere else.  They will not make exceptions for this, even if one of the people at your table is a child.  Aside from the rules, the customer service is awful!
author: Ms. K L.

description:
I'd have to say for it being on Market and being a small little spot; I'm surprised it's not much more busy. I took a friend here for her birthday and had to try their all you can eat AND drink! $30 a person - HELL YA!
We started off with 3 rolls, and some saké bombs! I do have to say it took awhile for the rolls to come out even though there were only two other small parties there but we enjoyed the saké bombs while we waited.
The fish was fresh tasting and the rolls were overwhelmingly made with rice.
we did a second round and enjoyed some appetizers and Katsu this time round - SO GOOD!
I'd have to say all in all, I'd totally go here again!
Oh and fun fact, The Mint, a karaoke bar is right next door. You can watch people singing on the tv behind the sushi bar!
author: Chris D.

description: Honestly this is the best place to get unlimited food and drinks. It's the cutest little place in Church and they really hook it up. Jessica is dope too! Best waitress ever; she really was awesome and really provided great service. Sushi is A+++++ quality too. Seriously go here!!!!
author: Lucenda D.

description: Tasty rolls in and relaxed environment! Fresh ingredients and the best spicy tuna aka dynamite rolls with substituted extra spicy tuna in lieu of seaweed salad due to a sesame allergy... Always willing to make special requests and they deliver next door if u rather karaoke at the Mint while u eat!!!
author: Basim F.

description:
This place is just a sushi restaurant where you can grab a bite before or while you hang out at the adjacent karaoke bar. It's not pretending to be anything it is not.

That being said, the service is pretty bad and the food is hit or miss. The "caterpillar roll" was pretty good, but the sashimi was chewy and had an "unfresh texture" to it. I honestly don't think it was sushi grade fish.

Regarding the service, we had to ask twice for them to bring any wasabi. And they brought our appetizer (seaweed salad) at the very end of the meal.

Overall, it was not that good of an experience. I hope they fix it.
author: Wes F.

description:
Got here on a Sunday evening--just in time for happy hour to end. Happy hour includes $1.25 oysters on half shells or baked mussels.  Other things include $3 spicy scallop handrolls, and other basic things suchs as California rolls and beer and what not. 

Anywho, we ordered the Sashimi Deluxe for about $26, the Seafood Salad (~$10) which is also known as Poke Salad to most of us (but with a bunch of other fish too), Uni and Spicy Scallop Nigiri (~$8/~$5), and a Cherry Blossom Roll (~$11). 

Everything was made nicely. The only problem was that everything was slightly warm. Not only their fish, but the "iced" water was warm. That was so weird to me. I understand that it was a warm day and the fish shouldn't be FROZEN. But it was WARM! Like left out for a long time or was in the microwave for defrosting. I'm not an expert, but my sixth sense tells me it's not right. The fish was not the worst I've ever had, but it certainly was not the best. But considering my hyper-sensitive stomach, I would not chance coming back and getting sick.

Oh, and there is a karaoke/bar/lounge right next door and to be honest, it is VERY distracting and if they suck, it's just straight up annoying.
author: Athena L.

description: Sushi smelled bad and was not good quality at all.  To make matters worse they remove my area from delivery . Bad
author: Gore S.

description:
I dropped by here last Sunday night for a sushi / karaoke combination.  Very good idea!

I'm always leery of Sunday night sushi, but Sushi Delight delivered excellent cuts of several varieties of fish.  Table favorites were the monk fish livers, as well as the "uni spoons" -- quail eggs perched on top of uni meat and roe, served in a single-shot spoon.

Service was excellent .  Decor is fairly crappy, but at least you get a live feed of the karaoke bar next door.

I'd definitely head back here for Sushi Delight's happy hour sushi specials (and more uni spoons).
author: Bill H.

description: I ordered through eat24 and even though it was a little bit expensive than I'd normally pay - it was worth it. I got the 49er Roll, salmon maki and two nigri. It arrived as if I had ordered it in the restaurant - immaculate. It was really tasty and matched exactly to my sushi craving for the night! Will definitely order from these guys again.
author: Jessica D.

description:
The service here can be much better. You have to literally wave your arms around to try to get the waitress's attention. They're are 2 of them and the restaurant is small, so I don't understand why it is so hard to get some service. The waitresses just stand at their booth looking down. 
A different customer had to get up off his seat, walk to sushi bar, and ask the guys behind making the sushi for some water. He stood there for a bit before a waitress came out with a pitcher of water. Instead of walking to his table and filling everyone's glasses, she handed him the pitcher. 

Aside from the inattentive, waitress with attitude, the food was mediocre. I've gotten take out here once before and thought it wasn't too bad, so I came back with a party of 5. 
If you're going to do all you can eat; it seems more worth it to just come here and drink as much as you can and order food as things to munch on. The food menu is quite small.  

I won't be coming here again. I personally did not like the service and the food isn't good enough to make me want to come again. Honestly, even 2 stars feels a bit generous...
author: Jonathan C.

description: Stopped in on a Saturday night after finding out that Choice A (Sushi Zone) couldn't seat us for 2 hours. Found an open table for 5 people without a reservation. Sushi was inexpensive and good, but not fantastic. Sushi rolls average 11$ for a special roll ( 8 pieces) and large beers are $6. There is a door leading to a karaoke bar next door and you'll find amateur singers on the big screen in the restaurant for your viewing pleasure. a good plan B for to find a table with no wait time.
author: Brad S.

description: Got the all you can eat and drink for $29.  It included almost all the specialty rolls and was a great experience.  The sushi was a solid 4 stars but for the $$ it was a great value.  I would absolutely come back!  5 stars - not because it is the best sushi ever but because it is a fantastic value.
author: Bryan D.

description:
The thing i love about Yelp is that it lets you find little hole in the wall restaurants with amazing food. 

This was one of them.

The baked mussels appetizer was one of the best things I've eaten in years. Truly transcendent and I am not a foodie or someone who normally gushes about food.

But damn, that was good.

The sushi and sashimi were fresh and excellent, the service good - it's not a fancy place at all, but everyone was perfectly pleasant. And no one was there for the atmosphere - it was the food they were after!
author: Alan W.

description:
Fan of this place coz they were open late on a Friday night.. Most of the food business around Hayes valley were either closing or long wait time for getting tables and Sushi delight seemed more welcoming to have dinner.  Slow service despite few people.. lively karaoke bar next to it whose singers can be viewed from this resto :-)
Food was good.. fresh(despite the late hour), worth what you pay for.
author: Hema K.

description: Wasn't expecting such good sushi after reading the negative reviews here. We really enjoyed the rolls, also sashimi was fresh and tasty. Delivery was fast - in fact earlier than what we were told, which is usually quite the opposite. I think they deserve a five-star within this price segment.
author: Selin E.

description:
I've been here a number times, or more aptly, at the Mint and come in and ordered from here a number of times.

The service isn't quick, but the price is right and it's quite tasty.

They have a minimum for credit cards, which always annoys me, but they bring the sushi to your table... which in a dark, drunken environment gets them two stars alone.

The fact that their sushi is basically on par with Tako Sushi in Berkeley and only slightly more expensive (it is SF) has won me over and keeps me coming back.

Yay one singular sushi place in SF that I'd regularly go to and recommend! Yay!
author: Meg T.

description: We ordered take out, sushi was super tasty and sashimi and nagiri very fresh. High quality, very recommended.
author: Ido K.

description: was starving and ate all the food i ordered for delivery. sushi combo, a special roll, and a free california roll. started to feel nauseous and threw up everything after two hours. I probably won't order sushi for delivery again. Probably safer to eat sushi served ASAP directly in the establishment.
author: p f.

description:
What a disgrace. I was (naively) hoping that my experience would lean towards the older, more positive reviews. I was let down.

The food arrived completely cold across the board, even though it was only a couple minutes late (normal on a Saturday night); the delivery driver gave me attitude despite having blatantly not looked at the special instructions box; and on top of that they sent all the wrong beverages. 

There are too many other Japanese restaurants in SF. Take your business elsewhere.
author: Will H.

description:
Great Japanese food!  really great food (chicken udon, and beef teriyaki), perfectly cooked rice, & quick service. Full of flavor. 



My only suggestion is to tone down the salt & sugar on the teryaki  sauce (it was intense even for my pretty under-sensitive taste buds that generally desire more intensity than many others' do). I didn't see any easy customer feedback mechanisms to leave comments for the managers before posting on YELP,  so that would be a great addition.
author: Sandy J.

description:
What can I say? This place is pretty darn good. I'm a big sushi fanatic and pretty picky about my sushi. My girlfriend lives a few blocks away and we frequent this place often. They have a great happy hour ever day until 7pm (I think). Even without the happy hour I would recommend this place. 

The seems fresh, the rolls are creative and delicious, the price is reasonable and they certainly hook up the portions. I knew this place was good when I walked into the kitchen and saw them shucking fresh oysters for happy hour. I've seen so many places that have frozen oysters they thaw out and serve (Gross!) 

There is also a sweet Karaoke bar next door thats linked up to the restaurant that looks pretty fun.
author: Uriah B.

description: Ray our delivery man is amazing!! We love you ray!! thank you so much!! this has been such a delightful meal we sincerely appreciate the food!
author: Robyn W.

description:
More like Sushi Delayed! Took 1 hour 15 to get our sushi when they said 45 on Eat24!

...But it was delicious and worth the wait!
author: Kate S.

description: Kind waitress, inedible food.  If you are starving and intoxicated, this place might work you.  I tried the sushi on a Friday night and it was fishy at best.  The udon soup made me gag :  Hot, cooked iceberg lettuce, sugary sickly-sweet broth and a yellowed broccoli.
author: Laura A.

description:
I'm a little lost why the yelp reviews are so high here.  Usually Yelp and I are in synergistic blissful agreement on the star ratings, but this one, 4 stars?  The only thing I can figure is people are rating based on the karaoke experience next door, and how good the sushi tastes when you're drunk?

Anyway, the food is edible, but I've had much much much better sushi.  Of course Sushi Zone across the street was our first choice, but the wait was over an hour, and we were kinda on the clock.  So we decided to take the dive here cause 110 yelp reviews and 4-stars seemed hopeful... 

I had the age dofu (tasted way too greasy...)  and of course a Natto handroll, and a spinach roll.  All edible, but again I wished I was across the street at Sushi Zone!
author: Sean S.

description:
5 stars may seem like a bit much for this hole in the wall attached to the Mint, but after one night sitting at the bar with owner/sushi chef, Ray, I became a regular. Unpretentious, great fresh fish at affordable prices. If you are looking for fancy $20 sushi rolls, there are none to be had, though the Shrimp Tempura Rainbow Roll comes close. I personally recommend the Uni Spoons, and daily happy hour with dollar oysters. Come enough and you might be on the wall of fane too.

BONUS: a live video feed of people doing karaoke sit at the bar. Very entertaining stuff when dining at the entrance to the Castro.
author: Benjamin M.

description: This was takeout, so I can't comment on the service... That said, the sushi was absolutely terrible. Go across the street to whole foods, you'll have better sushi there.
author: N T.

description:
OHMG. hands down the best Oysters i've ever had, anywhere!

get the uni, quail egg, and roe on a spoon deal!
mmmmm orgasmic~~*
author: Ellie B.

description:
I love the atmosphere of Sushi Delight simply because it's absolutely ridiculous. It's connected to a karaoke bar next door, the Mint, so sometimes the music can be heard through the wall. But the best part is that there's a TV screen behind the sushi bar that plays a video of the person performing at the Mint. It's HILARIOUS. 

However, this place is often rather empty, and since most people probably won't get as much enjoyment from the karaoke video, I gave Sushi Delight only three stars. Plus the service is pretty spotty. 

If I was basing only on food, I would rate Sushi Delight 4 starts. All the specialty rolls I've had have been quite good, fresh tasting, and well-priced. I can't attest to their sushi, sashimi, or other dishes, but I'll continue to be a repeat customer for their rolls.
author: Talia G.

description:
The "Eek! Methinks not" is spot on for how I feel about this place.

First, I made the HUGE mistake of wandering for food while desperately hungry. That will always lead to a lapse of judgement. After circling around Market for what seemed like ages, my friends and I stopped inside here since we love sushi. I should have realized its proximity to the Mint but I had no idea they were connected. Because they are. In the worst possible way.

So they are not the same owners, but this place allows Mint customers to come over via a flimsy swinging door. So not only do you hear the LOUDEST, most dreadful karaoke being drunkenly yelled, you will also have loud, drunk patrons stumbling in via the swinging door, loudly ordering sushi. And the worst part is that the restaurant prioritizes these patrons. I'm sure it's because they don't want them waiting around or coming in/out but still. 

But the noise, it will haunt you. We had the unenviable evening of hearing "Don't Stop Believin," some Christina Aguilera and some No Doubt. We wanted to kill ourselves. After just two rolls, we couldn't handle it anymore and begged for the check and left.

The plus side is that the sushi chef on this particular Friday evening was quite hot. But the waiter was rather rude and brusque. The butter fish was pretty good but the sushi was ridiculously cold. I don't think they know how to make sushi properly for a non-drunken Mint crowd. I'm sure if you're drunk and singing Journey, you won't mind that your spicy tuna roll is filled with all kinds of vegetables that shouldn't be in spicy tuna rolls. But if you're sober, you realize this is totally not good sushi.

And for the love of God, stop singing Journey at karaoke!
author: Logan The H.

description: I went with 3 people. We were all seated at the very small bar which seats about 4-5 people total. The chefs are behind the bar and you can watch the people doing karaoke in the room next door from the TV screen. I have small complaints but they were enough to knock it down a couple stars. First, you only get 2 hours of unlimited "all-you-can-eat" sushi and there was only one chef making our food, so it took a long time to get our food every time we put in an order. We placed about three orders total which filled everyone up. It is $25 per person but with tax and gratuity automatically taken out, we were given a bill of $31.28 each. Their rolls are not bad, but I've definitely had better for that price. They give you appetizer options that are part of the deal. We ordered Miso soup, edamame, and teriyaki chicken/tofu. They only offer rolls on the unlimited menu. No sashimi, or nigiri. You can order bottomless beer for $10 extra. I think it's probably more fun if you sit in the karaoke room, but if you are just looking for a nice dinner, then the actual restaurant side is nice. The waitresses were nice and attentive.
author: Sarah B.

description: Had food delivered the other night and the only thing that was even decent was the california rolls. We ordered udon, which the broth had no flavor. My friend had the chicken udon, which she said was seasoned strangely for the udon and did not go together. My tempura udon was only okay. The broth had no flavor but the noodle were edible. There was way too much cabbage in the udon and as i picked some out of my soup I noticed that some of it was brown. we also ordered a caterpiller roll. it was not even edible at all. We both tried one piece each and it tasted dirty. it literally tasted like the eel was not clean. i don't know why it tasted this way. we could not eat another piece. i was disappointed with everything we ordered except for the free california roll.
author: Tab C.

description: have you changed the chief recently, everything I got today was disgusting.
author: Aryan G.

description: Not good.  Blaring music, the staff is obviously high as strong smell of weed wafts from the kitchen.   The appetizer showed long after the food (how hard is it to microwave edamame?) and they don't have iced tea?   Really?  You have tea and you have ice.
author: Bob B.

description: Delivery: Just yucky sushi.. Hands down worst I ever had - $40 and we had maybe 4 bites . Yellowtail tasted like dirt and tuna and salmon was so fishy and warm :( ugh waste of money. Oh and the soy sauce was so salty never had such a salty soy sauce before. Yuck yuck yuck
author: Anca R.

description:
Came here a couple of time. Their foods have been consistence. Good and fresh. I always start out with a dozen of oysters and then everything sashimi. I'm not a roll eater but I have to say their voo-doo roll is pretty damn good. Their sashimi is so fresh i had to order myself two order of it. Oh, dessert. Jumping ahead. That fried ice cream stuff green tea flavor is something to die for. I am drooling as i'm writing this. 

Cleanliness: the place is cozy and cute. They have clean kitchen and bathroom *Plus *Plus *Plus. How do I know that the kitchen is clean? You'll know when u ask where the bathroom is at. hahaha... 

Pricing: Affordable. You would think sushi is an expensive meal but their price is very decent. 

Staffs: Very nice and handsome staffs. You'll feel welcome being there. 

Will i come back? I've been back couple of times and have plan to keep this place on my favorite sushi place list.
author: Selina L.

description: Taste of food is fine here but I had food poisoning and so did everyone else who ate with me. They need to check the sanitary. Raw food mishandled can easily cause food poisoning. That will be my last time having sushi there.
author: Peachie Y.

description:
If you're picky, this probably isn't your place.

The sashimi seemed a little un-fresh and their rolls were over-sauced, which got in the way of enjoying the actual ingredients. I'm a "less is more" kind of person when it comes to sushi, though, so if you don't share that sentiment then this review isn't going to mean anything to you. 

To be clear, nothing was particularly "bad"; everything just seemed to fall below my expectations.
author: David S.

description: OH SNAP they have a live feed of the karaoke stage!!!! Man, it was brilliant to watch fools for an hour while sipping a cheap Sapporo and eating some decent spider rolls. I'd go back just for the live feed and cheap beer.
author: Emily D.

description: Ordered sushi for delivery and tried a few items on the menu...two words..stale sushi.  Probably one of the worse sushi places I've tried.  I've had better sushi from whole foods!
author: Snoopy C.

description: It's was an overall ok sushi spot. Waitresses didn't seem to care, a fly and an ant landed in our tea and sake. Sushi was ok not cold. Lava roll was on Point and Sapporo was cold so they got points for those two only. Sorry to say I will not recommend or return.
author: Amanda M.

description:
Below-average sushi at above-average prices. 

What really makes this place a must-miss is the blaring karaoke music next door.
author: David S.

description: This is a great place to eat with friends. Next door, there is a karaoke bar you can sing and have fun in.
author: Alberto W.

description:
Pretty damn good! I was pleasantly surprised by everything. Our order of rolls was not only delicious but also very filling and fast!

Parking - check! 

Karaoke bar next door - check! they even have a flat screen for you to watch the action next door while you eat!

Fresh fish- check! innovative creations that could rival any other fru-fru Japanese hot spot.

Over all a great value and if you're bored just take 10 steps and karaoke next door!!
author: Lily M.

description:
One of my favorite sushi restaurant in SF. 
Fresh & Raw, love it!

it's a small place,  gets busy on Friday & Saturday night.

Perfect spot for small group, girls night out or late night sushi :)

Uni, Raw shimp-must try! If you never had fried ice-cream before... this is the place to go!
author: Zee Z.

description:
This place was so cool! I was at the Mint next door and all of a sudden I see people bringing out sushi so I'm like "Where is the sushi coming from? I LOVE sushi!"

I ran next door to Sushi Delight and wow was it good! I got the karaoke roll and the two-piece white tuna nigiri and was very pleasantly surprised! It was DELICIOUS and the fact that they bring it out into the karaoke bar for you was awesome! The portion sizes are also great - the karaoke roll was 8 pieces for 11 bucks, which is a good deal in my book. Also, my friend said that they let him build his own roll, which is pretty cool since I have never heard of a place that is open to that.

If you're ever in the neighborhood, give this place a try! It's definitely a hidden gem.
author: Casey G.

description: Very good Chicken Katsu Don, chicken katsu, seaweed salad is one of my faves and one of the only places I get cucumbers fresh from. I always get delivery, their very courteous and polite. Even called to confirm the order was correct. Will be my go-to japanese restaurant.
author: Risa H.

description:
My favorite sushi snob had this to say of Sushi Delight: "The proportion of fish to rice was a little off." He'd have preferred more fish, less rice. He continued, "The rice and the fish were each okay. I've had worse."

My spicy tuna roll was decent, and I think it takes a lot of talent to eff up kappa maki so no real complaints there. 

Overall though, this place left me far from delighted.
author: Miriam W.

description:
I've been here many times when singing at The Mint next door. Once you order, Sushi Delight will bring your meal right to you at the bar--super convenient. 

I usually order the bento box with three items out of over a dozen to choose from (including California rolls, pork or chicken katsu, potato croquettes, sashimi, veggie or assorted tempura, spring rolls., etc.). 

I'm not the biggest fish fan, which rules out a lot of Sushi places, but Sushi Delight has lots of yummy non-fish options.  The teriyaki beef is always lean and flavorful, cut in little strips, the gyoza is nicely browned on one side, but not tough, the interior stuffing is moist. I also love the teriyaki tofu (silly, I know, with the beef and potstickers), which comes lightly fried with a sweet sauce. Every bento box comes with rice, miso soup, and a small salad with lettuce and cucumbers and a yummy sesame dressing. The rest of my family loves their California Rolls, which are a great deal during happy hour.
