The food is brought to your table promptly, and the staff is always adept and cordial (especially Tinkerbell).

I really appreciate that they accept cards, which lets me save my cash for The Mint.
author: Umilia M.

description:
This meal was...pretty awful.  Beware!

Service: Too difficult to flag down the waiter.  The space is so small, yet he was constantly in the back doing anything other than waiting on tables.  In addition to everything taking too long, we never got individual plates (and how do you share drippy agedashi tofu without your own plate?) and couldn't get our drinks refilled.

Food: Not good...agedashi tofu was like no agedashi tofu I'd ever seen before.  Sliced tofu, fried, then sitting on a plate dry with only some scallions as topping.  The sauce was served in a saucer on the side.  Strange and bland.  I got the nigiri sampler, the fish did not taste particularly fresh, and some pieces were quite chewy.

Ambiance: The space is fine, the karoake on the CCTV was funny.  I think they have a radio station playing (not the music feed from the karaoke next door) and they just turn down the radio during commercials.  That, or their music system decides to play a minute of silence every few songs.
author: Cathy Y.

description: Ordered from Eat 24. I ordered a tempura and salmon teriyaki bento box. I got salmon sashimi and the tempura was super soggy. I might try this place in person - but I won't order it for delivery again.
author: Maggie F.

description:
Food:
- House Salad
- San Francisco Rolls

The sesame dressing on the house salad was too sesame-ee for my taste. There was a lot of sesame so every bite felt like there was sand in my mouth. 

San Francisco Rolls was also very sesame-ee. I guess they use very good roasted sesame seeds. Was a bit too sweet for my taste. 

Maybe just an unlucky visit or ordered the wrong types of sushi.


Service:
Waiter was nice and friendly. Checked on us several times to see how we liked our food and if we needed anything before the kitchen closed.

Environment:
Free live music from next door (Mint Karaoke). You can hear them loud and clear.

Time/Date;
Around 10:30pm on a Wednesday.

3.5 Stars.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
This isn't the place to romance each other, but if you want a mid-week bowl of udon with a side of nigiri, this is the spot. The occasional Christina Aguilera coming through the walls and SpyCam on the action next door usually enhances the conversation.

The mochi ice cream picture is so unappetizing. I wish they would stop putting it in every table's placard. ew.
author: Michelle L.

description:
With the name Sushi Delight and being the supplier of food for an adjacent karaoke bar, I wasn't expecting much.  My fear of karaoke had already been smashed this night and to my surprise, the fare from S.D. also surpassed my expectations. I guess it was a night of good new experiences. 

To be perfectly honest I never stepped foot into the actual restaurant but was impressed that they were able to find us through the drunken messes of people next door. Another patron was eating some katsu don and said that he was decently impressed. So I went for the spider roll (soft shell crab), voodoo roll (spicy tuna, cucumber, deep fried and then topped with more tuna and seaweed) and a some saba nigiri.  I also got to try some of the 49er roll which had salmon, unagi, avocado and lemon.  Everything was pretty darn tasty and the voodoo roll was intriguing enough, that it caught the attention of the girls sitting next to us. 

Again my skepticism was shattered (2 for 2 on the night), I actually really enjoyed the food,  and now I have a late night place for sushi
author: Kim N.

description:
I've been here twice now and both times I was more than satisfied. The service was friendly and the food made my tummy happy. My absolute favorite dish here is the Vodoo Roll. The sweet crunchiness of seawood salad combined with the spicy smoothness of tuna sashimi is AMAZING! It's like a flavor explosion in my mouth. Whoever thought up of this combination is a genius. 

Also, I used to not be a fan of raw oysters; however, the happy hour oysters here totally changed my perspective on that. I even slurp up all the juicy goodness left behind in the shell after the oyster has been devoured. YUM! 

There's also a live video feed of the karaoke bar next door (The Mint, I believe) and that can provide for some entertainment. It's like watching reject videos on American Idol...and I don't mean that in a dis-respectful way :) 

All in all my experiences here were good. Great food w/great friends? Doesn't get much better than that.
author: Natasha H.

description: This place is a staple for me. It's very conveniently located, reasonably priced, and when I'm feeling lazy, they have free and speedy delivery! No, it's not the best sushi in the Bay Area. But, the fish quality is good and the rolls are pretty unique. I really like their sushi/sashimi combos.
author: Jennifer P.

description: The food was pretty yummy! I got the Salmon Teriyaki with Miso soup and edamame. Everything was really good, simple, tasty. I kinda wish I got more Miso soup because the portion for side soup was like 3 good gulps (luckily I ordered two). It took an hour to deliver which was what Grubhub estimated. The delivery guy was super great! called me two minutes away and told me it was drizzling a little so I should probably bring an umbrella. Good customer service always goes a long way! even for delivery! Overall I'm definitely a fan and would order it again soon!
author: Miranda C.

description: forgettable.  service was great because we were the only ones in the restaurant at happy hour, so you can count on that at least.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
We stopped in here randomly after being at Fed Ex Kinko's across the street & seeing the sign for sushi and thinking "yumm! dinner time."

It was surprisingly good. Very friendly wait staff, fast service and the rolls & fish - which is of course why you go - were DELICIOUS. We had their hamachi nigiri, and salmon as well. Both were melt in your mouth delicious.

Their caterpillar roll was especially amazing (see photo), I could live on that one every day. 

It's funky that the Mint is right next door. You can hear the singers faintly through the large padded door, but it adds a festive party feel to the place, when you're actually enjoying dinner in a quiet and nicely decorated restaurant.
author: Willo O.

description: I got delivery from here once and it was pretty solid. Spicy salmon roll, eel roll, ramen noodle soup with fish balls, all were pretty good. Not great but decent. My friends were also pretty happy with the chicken and beef teriyaki. I'd order delivery from here again if I don't find a better Japanese place that delivers to my apartment.
author: anna s.

description:
My first visit to Sushi Delight was with a Restaurant.com coupon.  I hoped to eat at The Mint next door, but the coupon was only valid on the restaurant side.  
I tried the voodoo roll, which was delightful with warm and cold temperatures, crispy and creamy textures, a very interesting dish.  

The amaebi heads were served separately from the shrimp, which was unusual.  The shrimp was pretty good, but the heads were outstanding, fried to a crispy, delicate crunch.  

The aji was out of this world, sooo fresh, and served with just the right touch of garlic.  The aji's "market price" was quite fair, I think it was $6.  

Combo #1 was a nice assortment of nigiri sushi.  The standouts were white tuna and hamachi, but it was all very good.  Generous serving size on the miso soup.

Service was prompt and friendly.  

In summary, I would definitely visit again.  In combination with The Mint next door, it's a whole evening of fun!
author: Linda H.

description: Perfect if you're looking for affordable sushi with 0 wait time. If its date night go for the Dinner for 2 option B. Also. their escolar is pretty smooth sailing of you're into sashimi. Cheers!
author: Danielle L.

description:
I like this place for a few simple reasons.  I don't live near this neighborhood but it's just one of those small hole in the wall places that I enjoy returning to.

The menu has practically everything that I like to order.  Yes, it doesn't have EVERYTHING that some of the fancier or more traditional restaurants have but it's a smaller place that also serves the drunk patrons from the karaoke joint next door.
Since the restaurant is tiny I don't have to wait very long at all for my food and the service has always been more than acceptable.  
I've never ordered anything here, received it, and then stared at how poorly it was made.  No regrets and that's what I like at a sushi place, considering they're definitely not all created equal.
I also like that they serve saba nigiri on their nigiri combo plate.  Many places don't, and I'm guessing it's because the smell and flavor does not please all palates.  Definitely a plus.
author: Amber R.

description: My favorite neighbourhood sushi joint! I get takeout here a few times a month. The owner is always a delight to talk to. Their happy hour is also a great deal. Eat in and take a look at their specials board!
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
Better than average bento boxes.

Best part: You can have your food served next door at Mint at karaoke hour.
author: Inigo M.

description: The Vegetarian Caterpillar Roll is one of the greatest things I have ever put in my mouth.  SO GOOD!  Also, awesome that they delivered to our table at The Mint.
author: Nora S.

description: We ordered sushi by delivery so we had somewhat lower expectations, but honestly the food was just kind of "meh." Our salmon sashimi was pretty warm and the soy sauce was terribly salty. They also used a lot of rice. Overall, we had to rate this low, but hopefully it was just an off night.
author: Laura B.

description: I've eaten here a couple times before during visits to the Mint, but I've never come in just to eat. I was skeptical what the quality of the fish would be since it's always just been mediocre, but I was pleasantly surprised! First off, the service was super friendly and efficient. I loved the hamachi kama, spicy scallop nigiri, and hamachi toro nigiri. I'm usually more of a roll fan, but this time around the fresh and grilled fish did it for me. The rolls were good, but weren't standouts. They have killer happy hour prices so will have to come back!!!
author: Vicente G.

description: Such a disappointment and its a surprise because of the good reviews it has it might be just what i got. got the mixed tempura all there was was one shrimp and then potatoes, got spider roll and unagi roll both tasted like they came from a grocery store. I give 1 star for fast delivery.
author: Nina M.

description: I don't remember the name of the roll I got, but it had eel, avocado and crab. It was $11. My rolls had zero eel, all imitation crab. Maybe a sliver of avocado. I ask the waiter if she accidentally misheard me, thinking I ordered a California roll. She said, no this is the roll you ordered. I ask where is the eel. She points out to a dubious looking little speck of brown within the confines of the roll. I was not convinced. Granted I work service industry so I didn't want to be a jerk. I ate my non-eel containing rolls in silence, tipped generously and left, never to return. I HATE being ripped off. Ze end!
author: Ada G.

description:
Lets keep it short today.

Parking is non-existent but the F-Muni is at the front door and the Church Station is about a 5 minute walk away.

Went during happy hour on a Wednesday and had the following:
California Rolls-Happy hour special $2. Definitely a good deal. 
Philadelphia Rolls: Nothing spectacular but was decently sized for its price
Spicy Hamachi Rolls: Could have been spicier but had a good fish to rice proportion
Large Hot Sake: 2 for 1 happy hour special. That alone makes it awesome.

Overall food and drinks were well worth the price of under $20 for a small dinner for two.

Why 3 instead of 4 start though? Service is slow. Only 3 tables were occupied and it took a good long time for our order. Its probably because they only had one sushi chef and served to the Mint next door. 

It's a good quick bite but it wouldn't be a place I would take friends from out of town or a special occasion.
author: Joanna L.

description: Ok, so I ordered from Sushi Delight for delivery tonight.  Please people SAVE YOUR MONEY!  This place is a complete and utter rip off!  We ordered two Bento boxes with tempura and Katsu/Teryaki.  The orders arrived with ONE piece of shrimp tempura and what looked to be about half or less of a chicken breast for each serving.  Measly sides of Katsu sauce and Tempura dip.  Oh, and I've never seen pieces of white potato for vegetable tempura either....  for $14. a piece you would think that would give you a normal serving.. What a joke!  I don't need an enormous portion, but this was like an 8 year olds serving.  I will never order from here again.  I have half a mind to show up at their location and return this food.  SHAME of them!  From the reviews I think that they are ripping off the on line order customers thinking they would never come in and complain.  I feel insulted by the owner and restaurant operators.  Ouch, really??!!
author: Anna R.

description:
This was a tough review since it was such a bipolar experience with the food, service and ambience.

First the food, the sashimi was fresh and the waiter's recommendation was on the spot.  We tried the salmon, the hamachi, butterfish special, and the hamachi toro and did not regret it.  The only minor issues was the cut of the hamachi was not a great cut.  The seaweed salad was refereshing and a delight.  The other items we ordered were disappointing though.  Among those, the tempura was very oily and the batter very heavy.  I definitely wouldn't order the tempura appetizer again.  The shrimp tempura also dried up the shrimp.  The shrimp tempura roll was also oily and bland.  My boyfriend enjoyed the dynamite roll but I again found the oil that it was deep-fried in to be too heavy on the roll.

The sake options are limited but not unreasonably priced.

The service, as many other reviewers have mentioned, took a long time since there was one server for the entire place.  Two girls who sat after us but closer to the waiter actually got their order and their food before us.  I did, however, appreciate his good recommendations on the fish when asked what was the freshest options.  And he did have a good attitude.

The ambience was clean and simple.  The music and jeopardy playing on the TV was fun and casual.

I would come back again but definitely wouldn't order any of the deep-fried options.
author: Amy Y.

description: This place is ok for the price. Though service might be kind of slow due to the limited staff and how busy it can become. The all you can eat and drink for 29 is good (caveats aside), the quality of the sushi is good (and complaints about rice to fish ratio is bull shit from my experience going)
author: Shane L.

description:
The only reason why they got a 3star is because of their Tempura Ice Cream! Oh. my. god. god. god. god. d. d. d.

It's deep fried just right, sponge-y, and the green tea ice cream just completes this little piece of mouth orgasm right here in San Francisco! 
Try it with the mango ice cream too! Both are so delicious, you can never go wrong! 

I've tried a couple of things here. 
Don't get the ankimo, it's cooked too long
The nigiris are alright
Come for the happy hour for oysters and 2 for 1 sake
author: Miss C.

description:
A karaoke bar with sushi right next door .. what could be cooler?  Well, the storage of their fish, for one.  After waiting about 25 minutes for what takes most other sushi places about 5-10, I get a pretty looking arrangement of 2 things I ordered -- a Salmon Skin roll covered with fresh salmon and a oshinko roll on the side.

Just with the plate sitting below my nose I already get an awful aroma of foul fish.  This was my first indication that something was wrong.

I attempt to eat a few bites.  I'll admit, I managed to consume a few bites of this stuff, just to see if maybe I'm overreacting.  But the taste is worse than the smell.  The seaweed on the rolls is the consistency of plastic wrap. I feel like I just ate a day-old piece of sushi.   I thought, maybe the oshinko roll will be better.  After all, it's just one ingredient - pickled radish.

But the oshinko roll is no better.  Actually, it tastes kind of toxic.  It tastes like it's definitely expired.  So here I am with my pint of cider from the bar (unfortunately only my first), and it's the only thing here that tastes good.

I finally decide to go next door and return the 1/3 eaten plate of sushi.  I've totally lost my appetite and I'm really bummed that I just spent $15 on this garbage.  Maybe they could be nice and make me something else or give me a refund.

I bring my plate back and the cashier grabs it from me instantly.  I tell them I'm unsatisfied, the fish is not fresh and the oshinko tastes funny.  The chef tells me "gosh, we've never heard anything like that before."  I sit there for another minute just hoping maybe they will offer me one word of support to brighten my mood after I've been made to feel sick, ripped off, and still pretty hungry.  But they just give me a blank stare like I'm some kind of crazy person.

So my disappointment is not just about the food, but being given absolutely shameful service.  If I would have been given a replacement dish or even an apology, I would have at least left not feeling completely humiliated.

I have a few recommendations if you ever sink low enough to eat here:
1) don't order anything with raw fish -- preferably get something deep fried to kill off any bad bacteria
2) make sure you load up on mayonnaise and soy sauce so you can't taste whatever tainted ingredient they have today.
author: Evie S.

description:
3.5 stars! Sushi Delight was surprisingly delicious and verrrrry affordable. I'll definitely come here again for the quality of food one gets for the price. 

Ambiance:
-Small walk-in nook with a sushi bar at the back of the restaurant
-I guess one could describe it as "cozy casual" with its' wooden walls and sparse Japanese decorations bought at Japantown.
-The only way to the bathroom is literally through the kitchen. Walking there is a bit awkward as you can greet the chefs on your way to relieve yourself. That being said, the bathroom is quite clean!
-A sister restaurant to The Mint karaoke bar next door, enjoy embarrassing karaoke performances being sung real-time - they are projected on a flat-screen TV above the sushi bar. Be glad that you can't actually hear them.

Food:
-My expectations were surpassed here! What a deal.
-With the sushi combo A, you can get 12 pieces of fresh nigiri. Enjoy the likes of tuna, salmon, butterfish, mackerel, hamachi, etc., miso soup, and salad - all for $14.50.
-They've got a fine variety of combo rolls. The 49'ner is especially tasty with salmon, special sauce, and thin slices of lemon.
-We also ordered uni spoons: a delicious concoction of uni, fish roe, and quail egg. Truly a party in your mouth! You get 2 for $7.

Service:
-A bit slow on Sundays. I guess they weren't expecting large crowd of us to come rolling in. They only had one waiter, a sushi chef, and another guy in the back. I confirmed this via my trip to the bathroom.

Tips:
-Apparently, you can order Sushi Delight at The Mint next door. 
-Ask the waiter to have your group's Polaroid taken to join the slowly growing Polaroid gallery along the restaurant's wall.

As many a Sushi Delight visitor has exclaimed, "sushi-licious!"
author: Gina L.

description: Chicken wasn't cooked, seaweed salad tasted like fish... just hoping I don't get sick from this place.
author: Dave C.

description: I'm a regular here!  I like their VooDoo Roll, Labamba roll, hamachi-kama & for desert; tempura ice cream!  Friendly staff, and the head chef/owner is always present to guarantee good hospitality.  I also enjoy that there's a flat screen at the sushi bar, so you can watch the drunk karaoke patrons at the Mint bar next door sing there hearts out to the audience! lol
author: Jimmy N.

description: My spicy hamachi roll was not fresh, very dull. My partner's ramen was a boring let-down as well. I think people give this place high reviews simply because it is connected to the karaoke place. Come on yelpers, you can do better.
author: Mark S.

description:
2 years ago we used to eat here pretty frequently. it was closeby, cheap, and generous portions. not to mention the server and chef were so so sweet. we stopped going as much due to relocation. now that we're back, we went to this place and we were welcomed with open arms! they remembered us as if we ate there yesterday! what a warm feeling. 

they get busy especially on the weekends since they are linked to the mint karaoke bar.
author: Rosalee C.

description: The ginger and sashimi were not fresh.  The Dragon Roll had fake crab meat, which was not stated in the menu. The meal was not good. Disappointing.
author: Claire J.

description:
Bad sushi. It had lots of gristle in it. Also the shrimp tempura's batter was heavy and oily. It should be fluffy and oily. Tea was lukewarm. 
I'm glad we used a restaurant.com coupon. I would not come back.
author: Rennie L.

description: Best sake toro in town - in terms of freshness as well as giving a generous slab of tastiness. Good place to go for rolls and dessert (fried banana ice cream) and that's about it. Wouldn't order ramen or udon here with all the other great ramen houses in town. Owner is super nice and always remembers us and gives us a chef's tasting special (different things each time). Of course, watching the karaoke singers on stage on their TV is always added entertainment.
author: Aeon G.

description:
Not bad.

I came here last Monday night with a friend since he had a coupon. The restaurant was practically empty. The sounds of bad karaoke emanated through the walls from the bar next door. On the TV, you could watch people singing. I wonder if they knew that we were watching them?

Anyway, I digress. We ordered hamachi sashimi, unagi don, 49ers Roll, and the Dynamite Roll. I feel like we got something else, but I don't remember what.

Hamachi sashimi wasn't bad, but tasted a liiiittle fishy. Still, the texture was good. Unagi don is pretty hard to mess up. 49ers Roll was good, with its slices of lemon accompanying the salmon. Dynamite Roll was okay; the problem I have with fried rolls is that they usually don't come out right after they've been fried, which means the fried stuff is no longer crispy. So meh.

With the coupon, however, this stuff (and possibly more?) was $13 per person, after tax and tip.
author: Wendy S.

description:
this place is ok.  

i've eaten here a few times already... but was never the boss who does the ordering.

what's good here:

uni spoon (spoonful of happiness)  -  uni, ponzu, raw quail egg, baby topikos.  yummmy


why' the 3 stars?  its just average to me.

came here bc i got the $2 for $25 gc.... still ended up paying 60$.   a total of 80$ worth of food and left STARVING.  I dont remember this place being that great, but i can't resist the deal.  

what I've ordered:

sashimi plate- super thin slices of fish.  they were ok, but super thin and small

voodoo rool was decent.
author: Anna W.

description:
This place has great Japanese food-They have a bento special that is very affordable and everything that comes with it tastes great!  Their chicken katsu is the best I have found in the city and I love the salad dressing! mmmmm

Plus, they have a TV setup with a live feed of the karaoke singers from the Mint next door...so you can eat sushi and watch people dance and sing!  Dinner and a show!
author: Kat D.

description:
Happy hour is the best! Buy one get one free sake and some good prices for hand rolls.
Sometimes the food takes a little longer but its always worth the wait! They have a TV that shows the singers at the karaoke bar next door which is super entertaining.
There are two people that have served me there Jason is awesome and always welcoming. The girl that works there, unfortunately I didn't catch her name, is so fun.she is very friendly and always helpful and patient when we are ordering. 
The place is never that busy but dont let that fool you...i would highly recommend this place
author: Adriana K.

description:
Ok, so I'm struggling to not give this place five stars, but the food was just good not AMAZING so I'm trying to stay honest. Even though, I have to say, it was one of the more fun dining experiences I've had in a very long time. 

Sit at the sushi bar.  Watch the horrible karaoke on the screen in front of you, and interact with the guy making your food. I wish I could remember his name, he was funny, informative (with questions regarding what to order) and made our experience great.  If you want a fun, low key night with laughter and really decent-to-good sushi, this is five stars in its own right.
author: Mez L.

description:
It's possible to find cheap delicious Mexican food in San Francisco.

It's possible to find cheap delicious Vietnamese food in San Francisco.

It's possible to find cheap delicious Middle Eastern food in San Francisco.

But sushi is one of those few "cuisines" where you should instantly distrust any places offering it for cheap. Sushi is all about the quality and freshness, and can't be hidden by anything else.

I was intrigued by the $2 happy hour California roll special to the point where I ordered 3. California rolls should never cost $2 though, even during happy hour. They were just generally bland.

It's too bad, because it would be nice to have a place to have good food while at the mint.
author: Mark A.

description: Sushi Delight is great! Great food, great service and a great environment, what more can you ask for....friendly staff??? o yeah they got that as well! I suggest the Volcano roll! Happy Hour is a great bargain for food and sake.
author: Jay Y.

description:
Pretty solid sushi at good prices. 

Open late every night (11 or 12) which makes it great for a late night snack.

Rolls are pretty good, but my go to is the 3 item bento box for $12... love it
author: Mark W.

description: Last night I was at the Mint and I noticed everyone was eating sushi.  I found out that you ordered it next-door and they would bring it over for you.  i got the sushi combo B and it was great.  Went great with my scotch and soda.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
Nom Nom: Happy hour specials $1.25 Oysters, $2 Cali Rolls, Sake
Blaahhhh: Just ok sushi

So most of the sushi places we we wanted to go to were closed on Sunday but this place was open.  We went on a off time so the place was dead except for us, so the service was great.  It was happy hour and we got their oyster, cali rolls and sake specials which were a good deal.  We also ordered the Rock n Roll and Spider roll.  All the rolls were decent but not the greatest.  The rice seemed like it had been sitting out a while.   Maybe during peak times it would be more fresh? If you like just california rolls and sake i would recommend this place for happy hour but that's pretty much it.

:::Breakdown::::
Place: 4 Stars
Service: 5 Stars
Food: 3 Stars
Overall: 3.5 Stars
author: Manohak S.

description: On a spontaneous decision to visit a friend a block away from this place, he suggested this restaurant. When we got there, there was 2-3 decent size parties. Although my friends and I had to wait a little bit longer than everyone else (considering there was only one waiter), the food looked incredible, tasted "delightful" but a little pricey, in the end, it was all worth it in the end. Plus there was entertainment next door: a karaoke bar, let loose and have fun while literally the whole bar and sushi restaurant watches you perform on stage lol!
author: Mari B.

description: I order from Sushi Delight for delivery on Eat24 and they are consistently prompt with my order and the sushi is always fresh and delicious. I've ordered for delivery 10-20 times and wouldn't think of ordering elsewhere.  It does help that I live around the corner, so there's no driving needed, but I still highly recommend it.
author: Michael W.

description:
Came here for dinner last night with a few girlfriends and had a blast! The oysters here were so delicious and FRESH! We ordered about 3 dozen for the 4 of us and emptied out their stock of oysters :)

We also ordered the voodoo roll and the sashimi deluxe (fresh fresh fresh!!!) and also a few other rolls which I dont  quite remember since I was too busy stuffing my face.

 If you come you MUST try their icecream tempura...sooooo good!!
author: M W.

description:
It didn't seem that impressive when we walked in. The place is pretty plain, like hundreds of middle of the road sushi places. I was bummed that normally during their happy hour, they offer an oyster special but it was not available that day. We didn't take advantage of the other choices which was a special on California Rolls (I'm not a fan...blah) and 2 for 1 sake. Now to the good! Other than my initial impression, we had a very enjoyable time. Our server was attentive and the food was good. We ordered: 

Combo A - Maguro (red tuna), Shiro Maguro (white tuna), Hamachi (yellowtail), Saba (mackerel), Sake (salmon), Tai (red snapper) with miso soup and salad. This was the highlight of the night! The fish was so fresh it almost gleamed...! I couldn't put my finger on what else was special about it but my bf pointed it out. They don't press down on the fish. Some places will almost mash the fish into the rice that it almost loses its texture. But at Sushi Delight, all the fish are just sitting on the rice. Couldn't stop putting those beautiful and tasty niguris in my mouth. I was so sad when we ate them all. =( 

49er Roll - Eel and avocado topped with salmon and sliced lemon. Again all very fresh! I like the lemon taste but I never like eating lemon slices. I'm glad the lemon slices were small so I didn't feel guilty pulling it off the fish. 

Alaska Roll - Salmon and avocado. I'm happy the fish was not lost in the rice! It was very flavorful. I could taste every ingredient. 

Futo Maki - Egg, Shitake, Avocado, Cucumber, Spinach. Do all Futo Makis have avocado? Because this was the first time I really tasted it! I love avocado so this was a great thing. The egg was really good too, sweet and fluffy.

Spicy Scallop - Self explainatory. Bf said it was really spicy. I'm weaksauce so I don't eat spicy things. 

I have a feeling that Sushi Delight reads yelp reviews so a big thank you to our server who caught the questionable smug on my plate! I was just about to wipe it off but she turned around, said she caught that too and said she'd replace it. Is it just me and my mom or are other people used to wiping down plates/bowls with their napkins and tea when they eat out? I was totally fine doing just that but it was nice that the server noticed. :p
author: Julia T.

description:
I have been here once on a date.
I was so nervous that i ate the edamame beans with the shell on.
GREAT.

My date said:
Uhh, do you eat the shell too?
I was like " YEAAA of course I do"
No way in hell would I do that but it was too embarrassing to admit it.
SO i ate them all with the shell on.

Yes my stomach felt great the day after!

The sushi was OK, nothing more than just OK.
The edamame were great!
author: cecilia k.

description: Meh. Not worth the $25 for two rolls and nigiri. Tuna was inedible - smelled and tasted very wrong. Salmon was ok.
author: Katie M.

description: This place isn't all that. Aside from the overpriced sushi (which isn't even delicious by the way), the waiter was really rude. I'm not sure if he's just a waiter or if he was the owner but I was appalled. We had a party of about 10 but me and my friend had to leave early so I gave him $20 to cover my orders. He looked all annoyed like it would be so effing difficult and out of his way to split the check for me. Plus, I made it easier by giving him cash and I had only ordered one or two things. While he was giving me my change, he was shaking his head in disbelief like I just freaking killed his mother. C'MON DUDE. Have some basic manners. Never again.
author: Jenny T.

description:
I've only been here once so far (the problem with no longer living in SF) but I am more than pleased that I've found this place! It was a late Sunday night, so the crowd wasn't big at all (except for next door at The Mint). The shitake rolls were delicious, with just the perfect amount of sweet shitake goodness in the sushi rice. I also had the nigiri sushi combo and "dessert" was amaebi. Now, mediocre sushi places will give you the generics on the nigiri sushi combo, and I'm just really not that big of a fan of tako. So, I was really pleased that the nigiri that came out were not only fresh and melt-in-my-mouth, but that the mackerel was excellent and the butterfish was a very welcome surprise. 
A quick browse through their menu also shows that their huge group sushi platters seem like they'd be a pretty good deal.
author: Deva C.

description:
I yearn for sushi.  I dream about sushi.  If I was a crustacean I would make love to sushi.  And as for Sushi Delight's 'La Bomba' special [scallop wrapped in salmon], its like a tantric orgasm.

With that being said, I  enjoyed but didn't love the other food/aspects of Sushi Delight.

The rolls are cheap and good, if not great, and they have quite an extensive offering.  As for their sashimi I've definitely had better but it was good enough.  The 'famous Voodoo roll' is all hype; and if you ask me all that is wrong with american sushi - deepfried, sauce soaked, covered in accoutrement to the point that you can't even tell if there is any fish in there to begin with.  The waitstaff can be a bit unattentive and slow too, and considering the small size of the place this really should not be an issue.  

An added bonus is the big screen TV where you can watch the best that SF has to offer attempt karaoke at 'The Mint'.  After you finish eating you can even head on over to the Mint, through a door in the restaurant, and take part in the madness if your heart so desires.
author: Justin B.

description:
In terms of tastiness-to-price ratio, Sushi Delight is the best I've found so far in the city (ie, yes, you can get better sushi, but it's disproportionately more expensive, and yes, you can get cheaper sushi, but it's disproportionately less yummy).  You can actually get full on $20-25 worth of sushi, and without offending your taste buds.

The tempura there is also pretty good, and hot tea is complimentary.  Most amusing, perhaps, is the location next to a karaoke bar, and the live feed set up in the restaurant (so that you may witness the antics of the people on stage while you listen to their squawking through the wall).  Always a fantastic time.

We are usually there late on week nights so parking is easy and it's not crowded; could be a little tougher during normal dinner hours & on the weekends.
author: Angela B.

description:
Let me see here.....$4.80 for Hamachi Toro?  Wha?  Where's the hidden camera?

Oh, must be like old maguro, the kind that's turned ashy and gray from disinterest.  

No, no, I was wrong...while this is not as fragrant as the most extravagant (and ridiculously expensive) hamachi toro i've ever had, the butterfish was quite nice.

This Hamachi Toro was worth every bit of the $4.80 for 2 pieces of nigiri.  The rating for this sushi joint is a combination of value, taste, style (who am I kidding?), timing, and sake.   Normally, I'll something where it's a certain amount of stars and then some stupid disclaimer about value because, come on let's be honest.  I'm chinese and no matter how good the puddin' is, you can't charge me that much for something without my ancestors crying.

Now, due to my unfortunate financial situation as a poor starving, debted stupid student, this is one of those place I can go for sushi (after living large as a workin' girl) without hating myself, feeling cheap and dirty, feeling like I've lowered my standards, like I've really let myself go.  

This is not one of those places where the fish is sour and you bath it in soy sauce and wasabi in an attempt to disinfect it.

This place has legitimate fish.  The tempura appetizer was perfect.  I was a bit drunk already but we ordered 3 large hot sake anyways!  Come on girls!  If you're gonna fall down, fall hard!

I saw on the menu that there was yaki-tori which I desperately wanted to try during the cherry blossom festival but later did not regret not waiting in the hour long line to get HAMBURGER in the yaki-tori.  I want my octo-puss.

My favorite part?  The Ama-ebi came with the fried heads!  I'm going to come back here again and again for that!  Without the BF (and don't you tell him where I am, this will be our secret, ok?).  

In the end, two gorgeous girls got gorgeously drunk off 3 large sakes, 1 voodoo roll (eh, a bit too much fluff and not enough substance), 1 tempura appetizer (perfect, best tempura I've had), 2 pieces of butter fish nigiri (melty and I ate both b/c Marina can't handle her drink), 2 pieces of hamachi toro (tasty and worth the price, didn't make my mouth sing or my face orgasm but a solid second place), 2 pieces of ama-ebi (sweet, succulent, with a sprinkle of tobiko on top and a side of FRIED HEAD!), and I think we had one more order or some kind of fish.  But you know what?  I was too wasted to remember now.  The whole dinner was around $50.  I was stuffed.  And very very drunk.  

After that, we went to get some cash, then wave our knee high boots around on Market trying to hail a cab but since we were in the almost-castro, everyone thought we were lady-boys and drove right bye.  Bastards.
author: Christina C.

description:
Yes, I really loved their food.  They are right beside "The Mint" karakoke bar.  They have a door that connects the bar with the restaurant.

I had a bento box with chicken.  Loved it.  The serve was perfessional and very fast.

I definitely recommend it.
author: Kevin J.

description:
In honor of its Japaneseyness, i shall compose a few haikus about our evening.

We walk in. Seems closed.
Seated immediately.
First ones to be served.

So we sit down, and being almost apelike, im attracted to big shiny things, so the first thing i notice is this monster plasma screen showing people singing karaoke from next door at the Mint.

Girl is out of tune.
Pat Benetar should be mad.
"Beer please, my ears hurt!"

So we have a few BIG Japanese beers, and this huge crowd of people come in. Since i dont know who they were, i will catagorize them as English spice merchants. Our waiter sees us struggling over the menu and encourages us to order fast so we dont have to wait.

I cannot decide.
Spider roll or dragon roll?
Maybe one more beer?

So i plug down another BIG beer and we all order. Im feeling as lovely as fine silk on a wrist right about now...needing food. And irritable.

Now they sing Stray Cats?
Were not drunk enough for this.
"Sake please, good Sir".

Our food finally comes with another round of BIG beers and sake. We mention in a very buzzed state that sushi be some sexy food, and then someone said somerthing about Uma Thurman and i thought they meant she came in, so i whipped my head around to the door.

No Uma at door.
I think im hearing things now.
Beer will kill that crap.

So we finish a King's Feast of sushi and at this point, EVERYONE is convinced we are going to go over and sing karaoke. Except me...im a little TOO loaded to deal, so i start doing the uinthinkable.

Wasabe still there.
Dip finger in and eat. Joy!
Buzz in back of skull.

I do this, because its there, and im a grazer. They called me Cowwy HorseGoat because i graze so much. I also do this, because i dont know any better, and i cannot be trusted. The Wasabe is beginning to take effect.

Mouth full of beetles.
Waiter morphs into HorseGoat.
I smell like cartoons.
author: Mick F.

description:
The sushi is good...damn good
The sushi is reasonably priced...damn reasonably priced
The waitstaff is nice...damn nice.

This place is open late too....damn late.

The Mint is next door and you can see the performances on the TV.  Makes me question my desire to ever sing at the Mint...knowing that everyone eating their damn good sushi is watching my damn miserable performance.  Think I'll need a few cocktails to get the courage.  Damn lack of talent.
author: Lauren F.

description: Longtime favorite Sushi spot w/freshest fish or it doesn't get served. Heck, I've been bringing friends for sushi, drinks, and next door Karaoke for over 7 years now. Highly recommend swinging by...
author: thurston o.

description:
I had always wanted to try this sushi, and was encouraged after reading these yelp reviews. We went during Happy Hour, 5-7, $1 oysters (excellent), $2 California rolls, and buy one get one free sake. 

We also tried the voodoo roll, per many yelpers recommendations, and it was soooooooo good. My dinind companion said it was one of his favorite sushi rolls EVER.

The service was good, our water was constantly being refilled...and at a sushi restaurant that is really all I need (plus great sushi, and this place delivered).
author: S F.

description:
I was worried after a long absence from The Mint Karaoke that my hunger pains would not be satisfied. This used to be a burger joint and the fries were excellent.

Ray Cao with his gorgeous tattoos does Sushi well. I enjoyed my inari, kappa maki and miso soup. It hit the spot.
author: Infodiva B.

description:
I've always wanted to be serenaded during dinner. 

Sunday Bloody Sunday isn't SO romantic but I guess beggars can't be choosers.
author: Jay H.

description:
Alright, folks, picture this: you are at the Mint, having a blast but suddenly find yourself starving and craving something substantial to eat. There's an answer to your prayers... Sushi Delight. What can be better than Karaoke and good sushi?? It's truly a win-win situation.

An awesome choice for good eats while crooning your little heart out at the Mint. You simply go next door -- it's connected directly to the Mint) place and pay for your order, and they bring it out to you at your table within the bar. Delight even has a screen showing the singers from next door so you don't miss a beat while placing your order. Very fancy schmancy :)

The pricing is moderate but fair because the fish is fresh and delicious. I highly recommend the 49ers roll (sake (salmon), lemon, avocado, unagi) and the voodoo roll (with spicy tuna and shredded seaweed on top) is unusual and tasty. I also particularly love their house salad, which is generously sized and served with the yummy miso dressing.

Sushi Delight is definitely more of a roll or bento box kind of place rather than a nigiri place.
author: Jill M.

description: This place is right down the street from my house and has a great happy hour everyday until 7 p.m., which includes $1 for their amazing oysters and 2 for 1 hot sake (can't go wrong with that!). Definitely recommended for anyone looking for a casual environment and good, fresh sushi.
author: Thea B.

description:
When: Wednesday Evening 
Where: Sushi Delight 
Why: Friend was moving to Seattle and wanted to meet up for happy hour with plans to move over to The Mint for some karaoke fun on her last night in town 
Hiccup: Being the only person who showed up on time and, in this case, occupying my time people watching in The Mint next door. More on that... 

While I waited, I needed some substance and ended up ordering a spice tuna roll and one with spice scallop. Prices are decent given the size of their rolls, however, when I placed my order the restaurant was empty and I opted to chill in The Mint hoping people would show up. 15 minutes later, I was given nourishment of fish protein. Honestly, it felt like eternity and I normally nurse my drinks as my pint was nearly empty by the time I got my order. 

Only plus is they will bring your order into The Mint as I don't think people opt to eat there if it weren't for karaoke craziness.
author: S L.

description:
2 thumbs up for the awesome sushi chef and amazing waiter. I must also mention the TV showing live performances of people singing next door at The Mint.

Now let's talk about the food, "YUMMY" their Voo Doo roll is a must have. The sashimi are always fresh. As a matter of fact, the last time we ordered the deluxe sashimi our server gave us a pop quiz on the type of fish we were about to devour. Made the experience way more memorable (although I'm sure all that info have gone to waste by now). We also ordered a variety of sushi and they were all super delicious. Don't forget to save room for dessert..."Green Tea Tempura ice cream!" How can you turn down an order of deep fried sweet scrumptious goody? 

The prices and location are great. Walking pass the kitchen to use their restroom allowed me to see what a clean kitchen they have. Plus, If I can DROOL while writing a review, then this place is definitely worth trying!
author: Mimi L.

description:
There are three different sushi places in the neighborhood (I live around the corner) and they are all great, though they are very different from one another. This one is my favorite because I'm in-and-out within 25 minutes and the sushi is very fresh (not sure what Evie experienced...). 

My issues with the place, has to do with the aesthetics -- I hate the lighting and whoa listening to the Karaoke singers is a little too much for my ears. That said, I either get it to go or I eat it there with my headphones on. Seriously, you can't beat the price and the sushi is really fantastic.
author: Tracy B.

description:
I just moved into the neighborhood, near Dolores and Market, and haven't found my go-to sushi place until I tried Sushi Delight today.

My housemate told me about this place and their $2 California Roll happy hour special. Two dollars for six pieces? I've never heard of such a thing.

We went around 6pm today and were the only customers for awhile. The waiter and chef (two brothers, it's a family-owned business) were very nice and attentive.

I filled up on one and a half orders of California Rolls and had some green tea. Dinner for about 5 bucks? Can't argue with that.

Also, we had some free, semi-live entertainment. Next door is a karaoke bar, and they stream live footage from the stage to the TV in the restaurant.

Will definitely come back again, especially for happy hour!
author: Valerie L.

description:
The first impression is always important... 

me: "what the hell is that screeching noise? is someone dying?"

No, someone was not dying. And no, we didn't have to call the ambulance.  Is Sushi Delight on or near Duboce?  Yes.  It is, and it's a tiny little place attached to the infamous MINT Karaoke Lounge.  And THAT was what the screeching noise was, a cute, albeit scary little lady belting her heart out to some 80s classic.  Ahh, I could see this place having a very good following especially with the drunkies from Mint coming over for sushi or ordering it to go back into the black hole of Karaoke next door....either way...sushi delight is a bit of a delight in that this place has yummy sushi for good prices and is open pretty late.  The guys that own this place are friendly and nice so things are all good, in the hood? (wherever this hood may be....)

Too bad it's so far off that I probably won't come again, unless I go to the MINT to sing "I Wanna Know What Love is" ala Foreigner. :)

_____________
EDIT

OMG!!! this was my 99th Review!? Holy shizzles.  Pretty damn good for being on this only a MONTH! hahhaha...I wonder what the 100th review will be!!!
author: Linda C.

description:
I've gone to this joint more than any other place to eat in the city. I have my opinions set, for the most part. It will take a lot to sway me.

I was IN LOVE with this place when I first discovered it. $2 california rolls, $1 oysters by the half-shell, and buy-one-get-one free saki for happy hour - EVERY DAY from 5-7 p.m. And the food is HELLA tasty....they don't do you wrong with portion and the like. 

My problem is with the consistently HORRIBLE service. Seriously, they need a new server. BAD. When I first started coming here, they had a really awesome girl working. She didn't seem to last long...and now they have El Super D*ck working. 

He's grumpy, seems overwhelmed, forgets something EVERY time, and lazy. We'll be one of two tables there and he freaks out. 

I've stopped going there as a whole because I just can't take the bad service any longer...and it's a shame because I hear $2 cali rolls and saki calling my name.

But, I know better.
author: Danyell K.

description:
I can't believe I'm giving the karaoke sushi place 4 stars.  It was really good though. . .also a few weeks ago I wrote a review for another sushi restaurant saying I was not writing another review for sushi because THAT other sushi was the best.  I lied and I'll acknowledge that now.  People lie. . .it's a cruel world.

Sushi Delight was delightful.  Truth be told I was at the Mint listening to people sing karaoke.  My friend was waiting for his turn and I was hungry so I went to the magic door that opens into an oasis called Sushi Delight.  It's like discovering a magical forest when you leave the Mint and end up at Sushi Delight.  I actually asked the guy at Sushi Delight if they ever get sick of obnoxious drunks coming over from the Mint to order sushi. . .he was totally polite and said, "No, it's okay but people are loud because it's so loud at the karaoke"  You don't care about this. . .

I got a few rolls and they were TOTALLY delish (I'm a sushi snob, really).  I pared my sushi with an $8 pitcher of PBR which me even telling you probably will negate the validity of this whole review.  YES I was drunk hence the pitcher of PBR with sushi but it was a good deal and the people drinking (my singing friend and me) both agreed on PBR over a Blue Hawaiian (God Bless The King but Blue Hawaiian = splitting headache in the morning).

The people working at Sushi Delight are so nice and patient, and if you're waiting to sing, they bring your food over to you at the Mint (that's where the PBR pitcher comes into the story).  No, I did not sing for your information.  But some really pretty girl butchered Madonna's Like A Virgin.  Such a shame.  

Sushi Delight Rocks!
author: James M.

description: I would of enjoyed the place a little better if the staff was a bit more attentive. Everything took too long for my taste, so you better be with people who you like to talk to because it will help pass time. If you don't mind waiting for your rolls to come out slowly one at a time then you'll be fine going to this joint. I prefer rolls with a sweeter taste, instead of the spicier version that they had incorporated into their sauce on the rolls. I'd rather have sushi in the Richmond, Sunset, or Outter Sunset area.
author: Theresa D.

description:
I'm hoping the way I like my sushi isn't indicative of how I am in bed (no, I don't rate myself) :

Relatively simple.  Hopefully that isn't always bad.

So while I already feel you guys hating me because I gave this place more than 3 stars, hear me out.

Like I said, I'm mainly a sushi guy.  I'll try a roll here and there, but the base of my experience is all about raw fish on rice.  The fish here was excellent and extremely fresh.  In fact, I had to stop myself from eating like a starved hog.  My main complaint of course, was the fish pieces were a little small.  We're not talking tiny, but it's nice when the rice is mostly (if not completely) obscured by the fish.  This was not the case but the fish was really tasty.  Additionally I feel that $15 for 12 pieces (combo A, sucka) of sushi is a deal in the city.  I'm interested in going for the $1 oyster happy hour.

I was ready to downgrade this to a 3 after consuming my spicy salmon roll.  While it was fresh, it was relatively tasteless.  I had to bump it back up when I tried the caterpillar roll.  I think it was eel inside covered with avocado.  It was amazing.  I had to convince my dining partner she was full so she'd let me eat the rest.  It didn't work and I had to trade her some salmon.

Overall, it's a great place for what it is; a tiny neighborhood sushi joint.  Yeah, it's on Market Street but it never makes claims of being anything more and even eschews the ubiquitous "best sushi in town" tag a lot of places like to throw on their menus.  The staff were all insanely nice and I think I heard "thank you" about 8 times before I left.     

If you live nearby and are tired of relying on Hanabi for your weekly sushi fix, this is more than worth the walk.
author: Steven R.

description:
For being open late, I'm giving these guys a star above what I normally would.

It's my own tragedy, really.  I'm always in the mood for sushi way past the sushing hour.  At least this place is closer to home and slightly cheaper than Sanppo, my usual go-to late night sushi place.

The food wasn't bad.  The prices weren't the worst.  The portions were meager.  My dining companion had a bento box which seemed somehow lacking.  I had a sashimi plate which had the following things wrong with it:

1)  No rice.  All it came with was lukewarm miso soup.  
b)  Very thin slices.  It really seemed like they were skimping.
iii) MACKEREL?  What a disgusting, salty ripoff.

I left hungry.  Not good, Delighters.

Plus, maybe it's me, but I don't want to hear a rousing, drunk, off-key chorus of co-eds butchering Piece of my Heart while I'm trying to pick through my sad little plate of dead fishes.

But le sigh.  I'll be back.
author: Frankie D.

description:
This place has an awesome happy hour every day from 5 - 7 PM - California rolls are only $2.  Oysters ($1.25/piece I believe?) and sake (buy 1 get 1) are also on special during happy hour.  

Everything else there is pretty good and the staff is usually friendly.  A karaoke bar is right next door and sometimes you can hear (mostly terrible) singing ... they also have a television behind the sushi counter which sometimes shows a live feed of the karaoke stage.  This can either be somewhat amusing or incredibly painful to watch.
author: Dennis S.

description:
We went here during the early bird spec- er, I mean Happy Hour from 5-7. $1 oysters, $2 California rolls, and buy one get one free sake. The oysters were delicious, and everything we ordered was great! I Highly recommend the voodoo roll.

The service when we went was excellent, our water must have been refilled 10 times.  Not much of an ambiance, but really I could care less as long as the sushi is good!!
author: Spencer C.

description:
Went here w/ my sisters and hubbies for an early dinner/happy hour before heading to the Mint.  Decent sushi, especially for the price, but the real draw here are the happy hour specials.  The 2 for 1 hot sake was great, we wound up getting about 10 little bottles total (each wound up being around $5, which is less than a typical drink next door at the bar).

Service was good too, our server was kind enough to get our order in before the 20-person party right next to us so we didn't have to wait too long.  I wouldn't say it was the best sushi ever, but I would go here again if we ever found ourselves wanting to go karaoke at the Mint.  Good service, decent food, and very reasonable prices.
author: Arlene M.

description:
Fresh fish and small intimate feel. Except when the door to the bar next door opens. Plasma screen on the wall lets you watch the drunken shenanigans of the karaoke ninjas next door. 

A little more expensive than say, Kiki's, but the ingredients were fresher. Also the seasonings on the teriyaki chicken were a bit different, a little more flavorful.

Come here to get full on good food and fucked on sake, then go next door and sing "Like A Virgin" to your inebriated friends and onlookers.
author: Sol V.

description:
VERY fresh fish here!! It's small, with only a few staff members, but man, the fish is delish! 

first off, the seaweed salad is PERFECT. I've had a lot of seaweed salad, and this is very high on my life. even my friend who normally cannot stand seaweed salad loved it! 

The mushroom maki and squash maki were both reeeeally good, and things i had never had before. We had a variety of nigiri and each one was SO FRESH, the kind that just slides right through your mouth. YUM! the shrimp tempura roll is also bangin'. GREAT GREAT food overall!!

the only real downside is the small number of waiters. It was clearly hard for them to keep track of everything going on. get a couple more guys on, and things would be perfect!

plus, they broadcast the people doing karaoke next door on a big tv behind the sushi bar. what goes better with sushi than laughing at people doing terrible dances and singing badly? nothing.
author: S B.

description:
The rolls here are innovative and delcious. If I hadn't moved away from the neighborhood, I would come here all the time. It's decently priced (for sushi), and the quality of the fish is well thought out. There is certainly TLC put into the food, and it doesn't hurt watching karaoke singers make fools of themselves on the big TV screen (somehow they got it hooked up so that you can watch the action from next door at the Mint).

Come here, you will not be disappointed.
author: Andy A.

description:
I am always glad to exercise my "top of the food chain" rights but I am rather a boring "sushi buddy": straightforward-plain-and-simple works for me and I stick to it like a mussel to a rock. 

I might sometimes indulge on deep fried crab or shrimp and avocado but like it "real", with a direction and a purpose. Add avocado and sesame, add mushrooms and/or crab but don't mix and match: its fish, not a stew (or a quilt). Edamame first then Hamachi, Tako, Mirugai, Ika, Saba, Sake, Ankimo, Agakai to mention a few; Uni when available and worth it, ibodai (butterfish) lately; mostly nigiri [futo|hoso|tekka]-maki when hungry. 

Up the street, Sushi Delight have been my fix since I moved to the hood more than one year ago.  This open-late casual-style sushi joint features a good selection of nigiri, rolls and makis prepared on order with good ingredients. Good and attentive service (but better stay away from "rush" hours though) always above par, sometimes excellent; the "best bang for the buck" in his league, above and beyond after 10pm for miles around. Always open, open late with kudos to Ray and the whole staff for that.  

Swing by the Orbit room for a drink or Mission Beach for your coffee or dessert fix.
author: Alex P.

description:
I've been eating here since before Ray & Jason took it 
over. First it was a burger joint ( Hot & Chunky ). 
Then a sushi place ( Forgot the original name ? 
But the couple that owned it were fantastic sushi chefs 
and were very warm and friendly ! ) Now it's Sushi Delight. 
( It has been for several years now. ) IMO Ray & Jason 
took the restaurant to the next level as far as quality and 
presentation is concerned. They're friendly and Ray knows 
how to serve up some seriously scrumptious sushi !! 
They have a great selection even for veggie lovers. 
I live for their Dragon, 49er, and Rainbow roll ! * Drool !!!
Whatever you order rest assured it will be FRESH and DEEELICIOUS !!
This is a great place to meet friends or have a casual date.
author: marcus p.

description:
Certainly not the best sushi place in San Francisco, but it's charming and comfortable and really affordable. I probably wound up eating here more than any other sushi place (other than maybe Tsunami).

Watching people karoake on the screen is fun, too, if you're into schadenfreude. And thankfully you don't have to listen to them.
author: Maple Q.

description:
Sake Bombs...  lead to a memorable night.

I came here during my friend's birthday party.  Sushi Delight reminds me of 99 Chicken over in sunnyvale where they post polaroids of the drunk and happy customers along the walls. 

As you wait for your sushi, you can laugh at the karaoke singers that are displayed on the flat screen tv above the sushi bar.  I highly recommend this..  People tried to dance and sing at the same time...  hopefully they were wasted.

Sushi here was good.  I enjoyed the sake bomb rounds with the friends.

Get wasted when you're here because you don't want to remember the karaoke singers from next door!
author: Walter C.

description:
This place is a little like Cheers.  The owners are cool guys who take the time to get to know you.  You walk in and yep, they know your name.  :)  The food is great, but what makes this place a 5-star restaurant is the attention to clientele that you find when you walk through the door.

I love their polaroid photo spread on the wall that attests to their popularity with those who come in regularly.

This place is open pretty late for a sushi joint in SF (10pm on weekdays and 11pm on weekends).  It's adjacent to the Mint, a karaoke bar, with a door that connects the two places to one anther.  They also serve food to the patrons in the bar.

All in all, a cool place to go for dinner.  You feel happy going to a restaurant that is run by two people your age with a dream to do more for their future.
author: Aileen B.

description: No complaints about Sushi Delight! When i first went in, I was a little worried about the noise pollution of the Karaoke Bar next door and the live Karaoke feed playing on the TV behind the bar, but soon I didn't notice or care about these at all.  The service here was GREAT-teas and waters remained full and the sushi all came out well-timed.  We had an old restaurant.com coupon and they still accepted it.  After the GF and I had taken a LONG run we definitely needed this place. We split the Tempura Shrimp Rainbow Roll, the Karaoke Roll, the 49er roll and some scallop, salmon, and hamachi nigiri.  The Karaoke roll was delicious and we both agreed and stole the show for the night.  The low priced check was a pleasant surprise as well-very reasonable for the quality.
author: Rob B.

description:
Let me just say this place knows how to keep a sushi monster on her toes. Their appetizing menu is filled with fantastic rolls mostly under $8. It was almost too tempting to just order one of everything. I have to admit they took a little longer than expected to bring out our orders. I was constantly on the edge of my seat every time the waiter came out with a platter.

To keep us entertained, they had a flat screen TV behind the sushi bar that was showing the live karaoke footage from the place next door. At first I thought they were playing reject clips from American Idol auditions, but soon I realized it was LIVE entertainment. Yes!

Anyway, the food here was pretty good. Almost surprisingly good. My only complaint is that they use this crazy wasabi mayo on almost everything they whip up. Other than that, I was pretty happy to have gotten my sushi fix.
author: Michelle N.

description:
Simply some of the freshest, most delicate hamachi sashimi I've ever eaten.  $1 oysters, and two-for-one sake during happy hour (we didn't try the $2 California rolls).  

A friend and I shared the large sashimi, a few rolls, and a couple bottles of sake, and wound up just exactly full enough.  "I wish we could hit rewind and do that again!" she lamented.  

The service was friendly and just helpful enough.  And that infamous voodoo roll?  Outstanding.
author: Sheila A.

description: The Voodoo roll wasn't that great and it was very small in portion.
author: Travis S.

description:
So prices were decent....but average. The service, totally great. The sushi, not bad. 
The guys working were super chill, friendly, and the service was speedy. Although it was a holiday...they weren't exactly busy. Regardless, the server was friendly.

It's a cute little neighborhood nook, and the entertainment was tops. The flat screen on the wall shows all people next door singing karaoke at The Mint(my personal fav being the 79 year old guy singing U2...totally made my night!) Best part of the cam from next door is that they have no idea they are every ones sushi time dinner entertainment.  How silly.
author: dur A.

description:
I unfortunately didn't try any of their chef's specials, but my bento box was decent, if not all that exciting.  The best part were the raw oysters for appetizers.  If I had made it to happy hour, they would have been a dollar!

Good things I have yet to try: open late night, and karoake next door.
author: Fen Z.

description:
Great neighborhood sushi spot.  Don't come here if you want a yuppiefied, extravagant, overblown experience in order to impress yourself or your date. Come if you want a chilled out, down to earth, neighborhood vibe with great sushi and a staff that treats you like a friend instead of a guest.  The entertainment value is high with the LCD monitor over the sushi bar revealing the shenanigans  that are happening live in the Kareoke bar next door.  If you're a twosome, be sure to sit side by side facing the TV so you can both have a gander at it.  I imagine this would be a good safe place to take a first date, because if conversation goes into the nonexistent zone,  at least you still have the luxury of making fun of other people together.

Edit:  And you won't find a cleaner restaurant.  I just ate there last night and saw the 100/100 on their health inspection card.
author: Marie S.

description:
We were drawn here by their 2 for 1 sake happy hour special. That plus, our friend used to work here and that's why we used to come.

I HAD to try the voodoo roll as so many other yelpers have suggested. It was tasty. Yum. Yum. Yum.

The other rolls were okay. They didn't wow me off my seat and I know of several other sushi joints with equivalent or better sushi in the city for less money. 

But the 2 for 1 sake. That's what we came for. And that's what we were going to have. 

We had 15 min left and we asked the waiter if we could order 20 more at the happy hour price (hey! we're not alchies -- we had a big party.). Anyways, the guy said it was okay and that he would bring them out slowly to keep them warm. 

He brought out two, and four,... and suddenly when we asked him how many we had left, he said we only had 3 more.... strange,.. hmmm,...It took me later in the night  to figure this out, but after comparing notes later, we realized that there was no way he gave us 20, and when we counted, we figured it was 10, 12 tops. This wouldn't have made me mad, because we were drinking them after happy hour, but I simply wish he had told us this prior or even during instead of being shady about it. 

Don't think that we were taking advantage of their happy hour either. We ate a LOT of sushi there too, so our bill was VERY large, and we brought them  a LOT of business. No more though. Not with shady service like that.

I still think they're decent, and the Karoake bar is really fun (although they didn't have it playing on the screen this time), and the voodoo roll is delicious. So, it gets 3 stars, but beware the shady service.
author: Sue Y.

description: Extremely disappointing!!! Ordered few things to try.1st, the tempura was so greasy, one can squeeze the oil on paper towel, that we could not eat it. 2nd, the noodle soups tasted like a 'powder mixed with water' broth, horrid!!! the veggies in the soup surprisingly was lettuce instead of bok choi or other vegetables that are to be cooked, and with minimal meats used for the beef and chicken noodle soups. Trader Joe's has a better pre-packed soup than what we got. There was nothing Japanese about the food. The roll was prepared badly. Bad taste. Awful. The only reason we ordered from them was because of the rating. We have had absolutely great Japanese food from places rated less. Don't know how this place got rated 3.5 stars. Unbelievable, hope we don't get sick, order at your own risk!!! If it was possible to rate no star that would be the choice.
author: Yoo Y.

description:
Small sushi place next door to the Mint.

Thank god they have a somewhat soundproof wall so you really can't hear the singing until someone opens the connecting door.

You get the joy of watching said singers on the plasma tv though.

Affordable prices for good sushi...everything very fresh.  I know this should be the case in every sushi joint but, trust, that is not always the case.

Fave roll: the firebomb!  I still can't find this equivalent anywhere else.
author: Diego S.

description: Great place to go for happy hour. Fresh Hamachi is my favorite! Great tasting and fresh. I have been here a few times and the service has been 5 stars! This isn't the absolute best sushi ever but when I want a low key dinner out with friends this spot is perfect.
author: vanay v.

description:
Best Place EVER!!!!! It is small, but you can always eat at the Mint next door. Jason and Ray are some of the best guys and really know there stuff. The prices are the best! The food is very fresh. You can also watch the Karaoke Singers next door on the TV. The La Bomba is amazing and soy paper is available, which is my personal favorite. 

I am now there at least 3 times a week. There is nothing more to say rather than awesome!
author: Lilarose L.

description:
I was stuck here--this is the fallout place for Sushi Zone if your cravings haven't passed, so I'm unsure if it tastes pretty solid because it's desperation. Is it a three or four? Hell, I don't know, but it gets for, because like an old piece of pornography you've forgotten about, or an old blanket, it's always there for you, whether you want it to be or not. 

The price is 5 stars, to start. They've got happy hour specials and the like. 

The food is a solid three. I've had some five star stuff, and some not so five star stuff, so I'll again round up. 

The combos are so cheap, and super good--4 stars. 

It's there for you. You will walk out of here stumbling if you did the math correctly, and full of sushi to decorate your bedroom floor with after you lose it trying to fall asleep with a belly full of sake. 

I don't care if my math doesn't work out, just try the place.
author: Chad G.

description: I was pleasantly surprised how good the sushi was at midnight on a saturday night. Great sushi, friendly staff (especially the nice lady with the colored hair that served us at The Mint saturday night) and really friendly prices. I can't wait to go back for more!
author: Christopher C.

description: Well, first thing that i noticed is how the place is located underground which i find quite unique so that gives a plus point in this place. The food, generally was okay, ive seriously tasted better nigiri sushi but its a great alternative considering the time(It was thanksgiving eve) and many sushi restaurants i wanted to go was closed, hence i went to this place. The decorations is quite cute too, reminds me of a typical Japanese restaurant.
author: Cavin T.

description:
Whats better then Sushi and Karaoke... Well you don't have to listen to the music while you're eating but you can sure watch on the big TV above the sushi bar. Its so funny to see people just belt out a song you can hear but just see... good entertainment

But seriously the sushi...well priced fast service and good... i love sushi... but i always wondered what is wasabi... so i thought why not ask... the waiter was super chill and he was like it come from a plant. but the stuff they serve here is from a powered that they add water too. but if you were to get true wasabi it would be twice or three times the potency of what we have here... my friends and i were like damn. this stuff is pretty powerful after we just clean a few plates of sushi and our months were burning... 

GO WATCH PEOPLE SING AND BE SILLY AND EAT SUSHI WHILE YOU DO THAT... go times
author: Ravi R.

description:
Very good sushi for excellent prices. I highly recommend the Fire Ball...fried spicy tuna topped with fresh tuna. Unique and fun!

I am a big fan of the Orbit Room, down the street, and I usually leave there feeling very drunk and fairly hungry. Sushi zone, across the street, is tiny and often has long waits (plus-they don't serve tempura rolls! shame on them!) Sushi Delight, however, never seems too packed, and they definitely pull through with a substantial selection of tempura rolls. What can I say...as long as I continue to patronize the Orbit Room, I'll also be heading over to Sushi Delight quite a bit!
author: Shannon R.

description: Miso was okay. Tasted different then the norm that I typically like. The tempura rap was yummy! A bit disappointed in the tempura appetizer dish. For $8, it only came with 2 shrimp and an abundance of vegetables. I'm use to 4 shrimp and veggies for that price. The spicy mayo was a bit watered down. Had mussels with spicy mayo which were good but water. Mochi isn't home made and pre-packaged...or from what I'm assuming from the picture on the menu.
author: Helen V.

description:
It's great! Go try this place and see for yourself! The food was fresh and tasty. The service was really good. The ambiance was friendly and comfortable. The pricing was reasonable, especially the specials. 

Jason is a good waiter. He will make sure you feel right at home and that your business is appreciated.

It's a relaxed clean fun place.
Get your picture on the wall of fame, watch some karaoke from The Mint next door on their big screen TV
author: Caroline D.

description:
Sure it's the place of Karaoke Sushi fame, but it's also a short hop to other things in the Castro/Market/Octavia area, including my classes at the Center---- close enough that I've swung in several times for sushi. 

As far as sushi goes, it's all right. I've had the Rainbow Roll, Philadelphia Roll, and Combination B (or 2, I don't remember--- it's California plus some nigiri). On both occasions I chose take out (As I was running late, per usual). The service was quick and extremely polite- I almost felt bad having my nose in a book. One point for me is that the sushi does seem a little overpriced for my interest.

All in all, over 3 tries of sushi here, I'm sticking with 3 stars.
author: Vee B.

description:
A review of Sushi Delight simply can't be compared with other sushi restaurants.  I fear it must be rated on its own scale, as Sushi Delight is adjacent to The Mint, one of San Francisco's most popular karaoke institutions.  If Sushi Delight were tremendous, I would find myself singing karaoke at the Mint more often.  Rather, I find myself eating Sushi Delight when I patronize the Mint.

I enjoyed Sushi Delight, and I wasn't blitz-kreiged off my hammerstauffer.  It was decent sushi -- better than I'd expect for a sushi restaurant whose main clientele is wannabe crooners.  That being said, I didn't go all Bobby Flay with my order.  I kept it simple:  some rolls, some tempura, miso, etc.  The spicy rolls did have a kick for a change.   They could have been fairer with the fish/rice ratios (good rice, though).  I wouldn't say that the service was gracious, though it was fast.

I'd eat there again, were I to go back to the Mint.  I doubt I would ever find myself there otherwise.  Still, it's reasonably good, even if it's not destination worthy.
author: SalsaBoy S.

description:
A delicious plaCE to have a sushi betorE heading out to parties nearbY like REMEDY at the DNA Lounge. I ordered a tastY San Francisco Roll whicH is a tasty combination of Salmon and Tuna ( I think, i never remember exactly what I ate). 

While U are eating, you can watch the widescreen tv of the karaoke people next door  at THE MINT making fools of themselves, haha!!! or if you want, when U are done eating, just go through the door cut in the wall to watch.
author: herm p.

description:
Nice staff. Nice chef. Alright service. Less than impressive food.

$2 happy hour California roll, 6pcs, very nice and tasty. The deal's only good till 7.

Spicy tuna roll, unimpresive; lacked flavor.
Spider roll, oOOook...; It was not soft shell crab. I think it was probably shrimp tempura, and it wasn't even a big piece at that. That's my litmus test. It failed.

Service: Where's the refill on hot tea? I had to order a tall Kirin from the chef just to get more fluid... 

I still need to suck it up and wait out Sushi Zone down the street...one of these days. But Sushi Delight, still has a ways to grow.
author: tim y.

description:
I don't think I drank enough to convince myself it was anything above average.  The food is so-so -- kind of on the level of  enoshima. 

The novelty of the next door singing fades quickly as you begin your meal.
author: Tim G.

description:
A decent cheap sushi joint with some corny, but delicious specials (49ers Roll, Raiders Roll, etc), it gets a big thumbs-up for being next door to a karaoke bar!

A live feed is played on a screen behind the sushi bar... it's pretty hilarious to watch people make fools out of themselves while enjoying your meal.

My friend also says he spotted a former American Idol contestant at said karaoke bar...
author: Chris R.

description:
Attention Restaurant.com buyers...this place will not except your coupon unless it's printed out (even though the app say you don't need to print it)

This place completely ruined my birthday evening. My friends I had planned to eat sushi and then go next door for some karaoke. To my disappointment, things didn't go as planned. When we first arrived at sushi delight the server greeted us and showed us where we would sit ...there were 6 of us. After she sat us she didn't come back for 15 mins. At this point we were ready to order our drinks and get the night started. We mentioned to her that we had a restaurant.com coupon and would like to use it. From that moment on, she had an attitude and we felt like we were not welcomed. She said we were not allowed to use the coupon because it was not printed out (restaurant.com states that coupons do not need to be printed out). We asked to speak to a manager and she went to the back in a fury. Another 10mins went by and no manager appeared. I then approached the server and sushi chef behind the counter and asked what was going on. The server pretended like she  had no idea what I was talking about. I asked her again to see the Manager. She said fine yet stood there and did nothing. At this point, I realized that if I were to stay my food would probably end up with spit in it so we left. We left on my birthday, without food and with a very bad image of sushi delight. 

Management: Server was female, asian, long black hair. We were there on 3/14 @ 8pm.
author: Maria C.

description:
Just plain 'ol sushi. And, not even good plain 'ol sushi. Don't get me wrong, I like basic sushi. I was raised on it. I also respect the creative sushi chefs out there that jazz up their rolls... it's what keeps it fun...

In my humble (lived in Japan for a while) opinion, they use too much eel. There was eel in almost every roll here. I find that boring, too safe, and everything just ends up tasting the same. 

We asked to get the 49er Roll without eel, because I have never seen it with eel before, and the chef about had a heart attack. I know that sushi chefs don't like to be questioned, but go to any sushi place... and there isn't quite as much eel....

To their credit, it is fun watching the terrible karaoke going on next door on the screen behind the chefs.

An alright place for basics. Not a good roll spot. (Unless you really like eel!)
