author: Megan D.

description:
You can eat and get pretty toasted for 10 bucks!

I've just been for happy hour, and the buy one get one sake special can get dangerous. Yeah you're getting what is the sake equivalent of box wine, it gets the job done. Plus the dollar oysters (which I don't really like, but hey, you've got the option here if you do), and the 2 dollar CA rolls (the mildly retarded inbred, yet tasty cousin of the sushi world) and its a guaranteed good time.

Eat, drink, then stumble next door to the Mint to make an ass out of yourself on the Karaoke stage. (see my review on the Civil Rights museum for a good story on how 'my people' invented it)
author: Rocky K.

description:
Aside from the fact that our server actually "shushed" our table a couple times (there was 8 of us girls), i would definitely head back to this little sushi joint for their $1 oysters, and their two for one sake..(how can you beat that?!) The oysters are absolutely delicious. WOW. not fishy at all, the sauce explodes in your mouth and has a slight kick.  I think our table ordered 3 dozen.  Their seaweed salad is an absolute delight, so scrumptious, tasty and generously portioned.  I got the Dynamite Roll and it was pretty damn tasty, I keep reading about this Voodoo Roll so next time i think i'll definitely have to give that a shot.  The prices are very reasonable, and the quality of the food is totally worth it.  

  The service was friendly, even if we did get shushed!  What's even better is that this place is connected by just a heavy door to Mint right next door where you can bust out your tunes after having a few sake bombs too many.  We shut the place down & had some sake with the server & sushi chef! it was so much fun running between sake shots and belting out "drop it like its hot!" 

 Definitely a great place to fill up before heading over to sing your full bellies out!
author: Lulu C.

description:
Monday night for a birthday dinner and what better way to kick it off then watching someone or many someones singing their remix of 80's Top Ten. 

It was empty for a restaurant located on Market/Castro area. And I soon found out why. Rather than sitting at a table in a restaurant watching the tele, you can push the door open and have sushi bought over to the Mint Karoake/Bar. 

Apparently, it was lesbian birthday week and I did not receive the memo. So we told the DJ that it was our friend's birthday and that he would like to sing some Maroon 5, but he informed us that there were 6 other birthdays that evening. 

Food talk. Let's see. I really can't remember. Either I was too focused on the singing or I really didn't taste anything special. For Happy Hour, the oysters were a buck each but this was past it so a little over $6 for 4. I tasted sand. I had ordered the spicy scallop roll, and it was not spicy or medium, maybe mild. Explains my experience. 

This restaurant gets the extra mark because of cheap eating.
author: Thia T.

description: The Happy Hour specials are super great for getting tanked off sake. That's all I remember about this place.
author: Kim L.

description:
This is just about the best sushi I've had in a long time. Prices were cheap, the service was good, and the food was amazing! The fire balls (I think they were called that...) -- which were basically balls of fried spicy tuna with raw tuna on top -- were out of this world! We had 4 rolls and several types of nigiri for under $40. 

Oh, and you can watch people at The Mint making fools of themselves at karaoke on the screen right above the sushi bar! :)
author: Steven P.

description:
I've been to a few sushi places in SF and this is one of the better ones. It is fresh, decently priced, and tastes good.

I wish they had more selection in their menu though.
author: Joselito S.

description: Gross. I tried this place cuz it got 4 stars on Yelp but was disappointed.  I get that this place connects to the Mint, a karaoke bar, but so what?  I wonder how many stars this place would get if you exclude the reviews from people who ordered the sushi delivered next door while karaoke-ing.   The rolls here are horrible and the ambience...wait, what ambience?  There is none!  Anytime I pay over $10 for a roll, I expect way more in terms of quality.  I'll stick with Domo, Tataki & Sushi Groove.  Even Sushi Rock is better and that's saying something!  I added one star cuz the service was decent and the sushi was edible.
author: Toby C.

description: Looking through my reviews, I start to realize how much sushi I eat.  I eat PLENTY, so trust me on this.  I come here at 5pm about twice a week for happy hour.  $2 California Rolls,  $3 Spicy Tuna Handrolls (awesome), etc.  the prices are amazing and it is good food.  At first I was a little iffy about eating there, because of the name, but it was in the neighborhood.  Now Im there alllll the time.  Check this place out.  Happy hour 5-6pm daily, you wont regret it.
author: Brandon H.

description:
This place is definitely overrated at four stars to start. We had bento boxes, udon, and some sashimi and absolutely nothing stood out. Beef in the udon was an odd cut and two of the sashimi servings were too chewy to finish.

Location is just whatevers but the service is very friendly...just a place not worth returning to unless you live right there, and definitely not somewhere you'd go dragging your friends to
author: Ace Q.

description: Convenient if your sitting next door at The Mint. Bento (2 items) $10 bucks = small meat portions and small rolls. Gyoza and beef teriyaki not recommended. Stick to their sushi. If you get the Bento box because of the price and you want to fill your hunger, go with the chicken teriyaki (more meat) and California rolls.
author: Dennis S.

description: I shared a couple of sushi rolls, the agedashi tofu, and some fried ice cream dessert. We finished our food but didn't leave satisfied. The server is nice but I remember the food being a lot better when I was drinking and singing karaoke next door. Not my favorite sushi place but I did leave full.
author: Jerold R.

description: I've tried a number of sushi places and this is the best one i've found in the mission and civic center area. Even though I live next door to 2 sushi places, I always spend 15 minutes walking to this one. Especially when you factor in the price, which isn't particular expensive compared to some places in Soma. This is incredible value. The chef is incredible nice, and extremely mindful of food quality. When I ordered take out, and started to arrive 15 mins late to pick it up, he separated the noodles from the broth to ensure they didn't get soggy while my food was waiting to be picked up. A++.
author: Jason J.

description:
This place was awesome! My friend told me about this place a while back but didnt get a chance to try it until yesterday! So i was in the area yesterday and just had a craving for sushi, so i remembered my friend telling me about it, so i went. And it was one of the best sushi places i have tried in the city because i live here and haven't eaten at many good ones, this is one of them! 
Their service was good and polite, and their more importantly, their sushi was great! 
If anyone comes here, you have to try the dragon roll and sashimi, it melts in your mouth! 
You will not be disappointed if you try this place, from a sushi lover!
author: Q W.

description: Well well well...quite the delight it was. Our server Lynzy was not only a beautiful young lady but also quite the charming gem of a waitress to boot. We really didn't know what was good nor did we know what to really order so we said..."surprise us please." We were then happily treated to quite the spread of grilled tuna collar followed by a spread of great rolls and the best Uni I have ever had. The dinner was finished off with a great fried green tea ice cream...simply amazing. I understand we all have our go to sushi spots, god knows I have mine, but if your in the area or your being dragged to the god forsaken karaoke bar next door, do yourself a much needed favor and stop in at Sushi Delight...seriously, it is a delight...
author: Patrick K.

description: Came here for my friend's 23rd birthday. We had reservations at 7:30 pm on a Saturday and it was empty when we got there. It is a pretty small place but next door is a karaoke bar in which you can see ppl performing on the flat screen tv at sushi delight. We ordered 20 bottles of saki and they let us have it at the happy hour rate : ) The sushi came at an OK pace but it was great! my guy and I shared the SF roll and the caterpillar roll and they were both great. The servers were real nice and they timed each of our sake bottles so there would never be an empty one at the table. As the night got later, more ppl filed in and we had a great time. We even got the picture of our whole group on the wall!! though this place is a little out of the way from the hustle and bustle of union sq, I would prob go back here if i only had a big group to enjoy the sushi and watching ppl karaoke next door.
author: T. T.

description:
for the vegetarian that digs sushi, like me -

good selection of veggie sushi and appetizers.  but the reason to write this review is that they'll make a vegetarian soup for any ramen or udon bowl.  just ask.  awesome!

and if you're a karaoke-goer, just walk through the shared door to place your order, and they'll deliver right to you in The Mint.
author: Karen O.

description:
came for dinner on memorial day monday. got some of their specials - butterfish, la bomba, hamachi toro (didnt get the regular toro, coz it is in the "dont eat" list - monterey bay aquarium). The hamachi toro was SO good that we got another order of it.
Also got the sashimi combo and the Voodoo roll. Voodoo roll is extremely unique and very delish. sashimi combo had 6 types of fish - very fresh... all this plus a bottle of sake for approx 50$. seems very reasonable to me!
overall, all the sushi/sashimi was pretty good quality and reasonably priced. and good service. i'm sensing that this might soon become in my list of "regular" places along with underground sushi, amesia hide and sushi zone...
author: Priya K.

description: Extremely nice guys, big fat rolls, they'll bring it all to my table while I watch yet another rendition of "Since U Been Gone" or that tired old anthem "Dont' Stop Believin" for the 8millionth time.  Sushi snobs need not apply.
author: Maria D.

description: Where to begin? The only reason we even knew this place existed was because my bf bought a coupon deal for this "restaurant." It was a BAD sign that the restaurant was completely empty, but we decided to give it a try. I had glanced at the ratings and reviews on yelp so I was not ignorant to the fact that it was next to the Mint. I just didn't realize how loud it would be. Try incredibly loud. You can hear all the bass and singing, the walls reverberate. And for some reason, Sushi Delight's staff is ridiculous enough to have their own music on at the same time. It's a maddening combination. We asked them to turn their music off so we would only have to listen to one really loud thing, but they only turned it down a little. Then, right after we ordered food, we realized we just couldn't take it so we asked for our food to go, they said they wouldn't allow take out with a coupon deal, we balked. "What's the difference," we asked. We said we couldn't stand the noise and were told (more than once) that 'if we don't like the noise we can leave, they can't do anything about it. If we want a high-end place, then go.' We did. The loud noise wasn't their fault, but the bad attitude is. It seems the majority of people who eat here are spilling over from the Mint and maybe they're so drunk and hungry they don't care about the quality of the food. Moral of story: NEVER EAT HERE.
author: K H.

description: You have to have alcohol and sushi if you are gonna Karaoke!  This place was pretty damn good.  We had the tempura, and a sashimi sampler and some edemame sent over to us while at the mint and waiting for the KJ Nazi to call our song up!
author: A P.

description:
so since sushi zone no longer does take out (BOO!) i went to sushi delight b/c i was busy, starving and needing sushi bad, and didn't have time to sit down.

i'd never been to sushi d. but i'd been by it several times (the Mint is next door), and it too is only a block from my house.  the menu is huge, prices are good, fish was yummy and fresh (probably same supplier as sushi zone) and they weren't packed to the gills like the zone always is.   fun thing - you can watch the karaoke-ers next door on a monitor while you wait for your food and dream of being a rockstar.  they're very fast, very nice, and have my favorite nigori sake, "slurp".  they also have good vegetarian options if you don't eat the raw stuff.  that asparagus tempura maki was delictable!

so yes, i too love the "zone" but when you can't get in there to even put your name on the list, i say go down the street to the "delight" and try it out.  they're even open til 12:30am on Fri and Sat - grab a roll while you're waiting to sing "Love is a Battlefield" next door.
author: Suzanne A.

description:
For being a sushi bar attached to a karaoke bar, the sushi is pretty damn good.  The prices are reasonable.  I'd recommend the Tempura Rainbow roll or the Rock and Roll.  Hit up the happy hour specials from 5p-7p ($1.25 Oysters, $2 California Roll, Buy 1 Get 1 Free House Sake).

Dine-in: The atmosphere isn't that great for dine-in since you can hear the karaoke singing/music from next door competing with Sushi Delight's music.  Strangely, they pipe in video from karaoke bar to play behind the sushi bar, but not the audio.  Honestly, the waitstaff is pretty terrible based on multiple visits.  That said, I've never eaten at the sushi bar, where I suspect you may get better service.

Takeout: You can order to-go or phone ahead for takeout.  When I arrived to get my order Ray was just starting on it.  The waitress offered me free hot tea or soup while I waited.  I declined, but Ray still packed up two free orders of Miso soup with my sushi for the extra wait, which was a nice gesture.

To-go for the Mint:
They will bring your sushi order to yourr table at the Mint if you like,  I've never done this but I could see that being pretty handy.

My 3 star rating is based on 4 stars for food, 2 for Atmosphere, 2 for Service.
author: Jared D.

description: The food tasted great, though this definitely isn't my favorite roll place.  It was a fun place for a mellow dinner with friends and some sake and beer.  And then I thought there was some reality tv being shown on the tv behind the sushi bar. Nope- it was live video of the karaoke bar next door.  Maybe I didn't have their best stuff, but I would've given this place a three, but the attached karaoke is too entertaining to leave at just three.
author: Robert G.

description:
i like this place because it's open late (yay!).  i used to go to this place in russian hill because it was open late (and is cheap), but sushi delight tastes a lot better than the place in russian hill... so this will be my new late night cheap sushi spot.
i came on a saturday night (around 11ish) and found parking easily.
we ordered the 49er roll, shrimp tempura rainbow roll, an alaskan roll, and a chicken karrage appetizer.  everything was good except for the chicken; i wouldn't order it again.
author: H. L.

description: Their Voodoo Roll is really good, but I don't get it deep fryed as it is on the menu. They also have a pretty good selection of cold sake which is one of my favorite alcoholic beverages. They also have a TV  where you can watch the folks next door sing karaoke, which is rather entertaining.
author: Danielle S.

description: craving oysters at 11pm on a friday night. pretty hard to find so Iooked on yelp and realized that this place close at 12:30 so I came. Although they messed up my ramen order, the guy apologized. I understand because it was a crazy night and he was the only person working. I don't understand why they only had one server though. Anyhow, the food was GOOD, the oysters were fresh, I had to order 2 orders. I forgot what sushi roll we ordered but it was sooo good. omg.. im so coming back.
author: A L.

description: I came in with my friends for a quick dinner before we went out. I had the Sake Don and it was great.  The prices were decent and the food pretty good.  If I were in the area again and wanted sushi I would definitely drop by again.
author: Laura C.

description: If I were honest I'd give this a 4/5 but because I feel its not getting a good shake by people who get drunk at the Mint, eat the food, and decide, "Hey I can rate this place even though I don't really remember jack shit about the meal", I've upped the ante with a 5 star rating.  Far as I'm concerned this place rocks, my neighborhood joint with good fish and friendly service.  I keep going other places to try other sushi and end up coming back here b/c its just good sushi for a good price with friendly owners.  I think its the most consistent sushi restaurant at its level (not super high end, not super low end) that I frequent in the city.  I recommend any sashimi and my favorite roll is their dynamite which looks great and tastes great, but really its hard to go wrong here for good food and good value.
author: Dustin P.

description:
I ordered food here last week because my friend was celebrating her birthday in the adjoining room, at The Mint. The food was pretty good, but the service sucked. 

I ordered, tipped 20% when I paid, and they were supposed to deliver it next door. Half an hour later, no food - I popped my head in to check in, and the food was sitting there - the deliverer was in the back on his cell phone. He came out, said he'd deliver it - food came 5 minutes later, with no pickled ginger. Our group asked for some and the guy still hadn't brought it five minutes later - so we went next door AGAIN and got it ourselves.

Lesson learned: Don't tip in advance - there's no incentive for good service!
author: Allie W.

description:
Sushi Delight is great - the food is fresh, the prices are very reasonable & the people who work here are super nice!

A huge plus is their extensive vegetarian sushi options ... they have more choices than the standard veggie rolls. The Veggie Delight & Veggie Caterpillar rolls are two of my favorite. 

I eat here all the time - it's a great place for a nice, casual, inexpensive sushi meal!
author: Sapna M.

description: The florescent glow in the window says "Late Night Sushi" which is either a good thing or really sketchy. Our group bit the bullet and decided to try it a little late on a Sunday night. We decided to steer clear of the nigiri and just go with rolls to be safe. The voodoo roll with tuna, salmon and seaweed was definitely the highlight. All in all the place was nice and clean with good green tea and miso soup on the house. Not a bad spot for a late night sushi craving. Maybe next time I'll be brave and try some nigiri.
author: Michael E.

description: I wouldn't say I am a very adventurous sushi connoisseur, but I do love the stuff.  The service here is always so friendly and whenever I order take out, my food is ready in ten minutes. I love this place for what it is: low-key, fast and delicious!
author: Justine K.

description:
was going to a bye bye party for an ex-coworker at the mint.  some of us hadn't had any dinner so we came here since it was right next door...
turns out the sushi chef at the time used to be at the place in the mission that's now the voodoo lounge... i was at the previous place the day before they were going to close...
pretty strange...
anyway, the food at sushi delight was good and inexpensive... nothing mindblowing but fresh when we were there...
author: charlotte s.

description: The prices were good.  The butternut nigiri was good.  The white tuna was good.  Wasn't to crazy about the 49r's roll.  overall it was alright.  A full star goes to the $1 oysters.  That was yummy, but needed to be a bit colder!
author: Lynnette P.

description: This place is great, it is always packed and the rolls never disappoint. But the best part has to be the live feed from The Mint next door. I never get bored of watching someone make a fool of them self singing karaoke and to make it even better, it's just the video feed and not the singing so you can eat your dinner without recoiling from eardrum assault.
author: Rachel F.

description:
what is everyone smoking? four, five stars?  seriously...

this place is OK - but seriously less than great.  this place benefits from the drunkenness of late-night karaoke reviewers...


...not that there is anything wrong with that.

but if you are trying to get a great meal and expect one here sober, you will be disappointed.  

probably worth three stars, but man, these reviews are inflated for sure! this town has so much good sushi!
author: Jason B.

description: This place was empty when we first walked in.  We ordered a few rolls but it was bare minimum.  The roll I enjoyed was the Philadelphia Roll, and that's as plain as it gets.  The good part of the roll was the added scallions.  It was okay but I enjoy fusion rolls with a twist.
author: Cindy V.

description:
I was surprised at how good this place was.  It doesn't look like it would be all that spectacular.  In fact, i would give it 5 stars, except that the music they played was unbearable. I would have preferred they pump in the karaoke from next door.  I had no idea so much bad music even existed.  I think there was some Creed, some Hillary Duff, some awful pop-country, that ala-hoohoo song.

If 12-year old girls liked sushi, this place would be famous.
author: Ryan B.

description: Best sushi place in the city! I love the sashimi, chirashi, spicy tuna roll, seaweed salad, and bento boxes. Also, the salad dressing is to die for.
author: a b.

description: My wife and I are self proclaimed sushi freaks.  Ray's place is comfortable, friendly and a perfect spot for us to drop in any day of the week (even Monday when Kenny is behind the counter).  Delight is truly the place we go where everyone knows our name.  There are other more traditional sushi bars that we frequent (for the ambiance or a particular dish) but we always make it to Ray's place when we can.  If you are looking for a clean, convenient place to stop by and make yourself into a regular, this is it.  The happy hour deal is great and you can always make fun of the karaoke singers on the big screen.  We recommend the bar seats.
author: Drew C.

description:
Pros: A flat screen TV shows the wannabe performers singing and dancing their hearts out right next door at the Mint. I wonder...how many know they are on camera for the entertainment of the sushi diners next door? The servers were nice, the menus were clear, and the combination rolls seemed unique.

Cons: The vegetables and sushi were rubbery.
author: Jacqueline G.

description: Went here solely because of what I found on my Yelp App on my phone. To my and my girlfriends surprise, this place was pretty good! Everything that we ordered tasted fresh and the service was good. It can be a bit noisy because of the Mint next door, but, Its what is expected from a Karaoke bar on a Friday night. If you come here and like deserts, I highly recommend the tempura ice cream!! AWESOME! Never seen it anywhere else, and never heard about it. Solid sushi restaurant!
author: Maxwell D.

description:
why oh why does this place have 4 stars?? 
we ordered takeout - miso soup, goma ae (spinach with sesame dressing), hamachi sashimi, inari, and we decided to try a salmon skin roll. what a terrible mistake. the goma ae was a ball of cooked spinach leaves sitting in and covered with a thick paste. not tasty :(  the sashimi was decent as was the miso. but the salmon skin roll and the inari were not good at all. the salmon skin roll was so salty that we couldn't eat it. the inari had a really weird flavor and wasn't really sweet.  
in good news, the bill is cheap. in bad news, not so cheap if you can't eat half the meal.
author: Sushmita S.

description:
i totally live here.
if your looking for cheap bites and a friendly crowd this is the place. 

when i was looking for apartments in san francisco i checked out a place on duboce. it was kinda pricie but cute so i decided to checkout the hood and see what it had to offer. taco bell/kfc, not so much. then i saw sushi delight next to kareoke. was it a dream or had i just found heaven?
i went in and sat at the bar and started chatting up the ray, the sushi chef, and his brother jason the waiter. the were so funny. i don't remember what i had that first night but i think i've worked my way across the menu and bake in the year living around the corner from there.
a joke that started early on was about the fish balls on the menu. when i order them i like to say very loud and proud " i would like one order of ray's delicious spicy balls" this always makes him smile no matter how busy they are. they're quite tasty if you like balls.
the pork katsu don is also very tasty, it's under eight bucks and comes with miso soup and a salad.
the albacore is always great as is the hamachi toro, when they've got it.
if you want exotic go somewhere else. 
for the price you really can't beat the quality at  sushi delight.
author: tinkerbell e.

description: this place is like my second home. i always order my "usual" and its practically ready for me by the time can say "i'll have....". service, great. attentive and friendly. honestly, i have not been asked to have my picture on their wall of poleroids, thats the only downfall. but i dont like having my picture taken anyway.
author: coffeecake j.

description: This place is super close to our apartment, so we can walk there & back which is really nice. Its a cute little space, very clean (always a +), the prices are reasonable & the food is pretty good I'd say so we'll def be back when we get our cravings for Japanese. It's also pretty cool to watch the karaoke "stars" from next door :)  I do have to say that the waitress was not so great, she was nice & all but a bit pushy and almost verging on rude - I don't think she was trying to be but my husband ordered a sushi roll and finished it all but one piece - because he didn't like that type of fish but decided to try it anyway. She sorta scolded him on not finishing the fish & told him next time to NOT order that kind of fish since he didn't like it - it was just not nice the way she said it, you could tell she was trying to be nice about it but she was coming off as being annoyed. While we saw her point - we did pay for the food & he didnt intentionally waste the food...it was just overbearing & it was an odd way to talk to paying customers....but other than that it was good.
author: Kimberly R.

description: been going here for years.  if I have a sushi craving, this is one of the places I hit up.  prices are about the norm and some a good bargain.  the food is really good.   parking is difficult to come by since it's on the tough part of market street to find parking.   the place is not all that big, but the times I've been there, finding a table hasn't been a difficulty.  it's also pretty amusing that the place is connected next door to a karaoke and you can see the participants on the video screen and hear the performances (it's even louder in the actual bar.)
author: Richie W.

description:
this is our neighborhood sushi spot.  every time we get food from here--whether we eat in and watch karaoke on the big screen tv or order take out--its right on.

gyoza is d-lish
the tempura is never soggy or over-tempura'd
the fish is always fresh. 

the guys that work there are very cool and friendly.  great environment!
author: Vinyl J.

description: The sushi chef is really nice and always has great recommendations. They have some great rolls and my new fav is the fireball!
author: gary a.
